overall experience good, nothing extra ordinary. Good value though!!

review.reviewText: Came for a birthday with my boyfriend & we had a great experience!

review.title: great hotel on the inside!
review.reviewText: i was surprised when we rolled up at how not-fancy this hotel looked.  But it was great on the inside.  The staff was superb and attentive.  Our room was very clean and very comfortable.  We had an issue with our frig not working and omg...they came and brought us a new frig within 10 min.  It was awesome.
review.negativeRemarks: FREE WI-FI!!  OMG $10 a day for WIFI???? NOOOOO
review.locationRemarks: great location for airport.  LOTS LOTS LOTS of fantastic food nearby.   HIGHLY recommended.

review.title: Airport hotel adds to travel stress
review.reviewText: The Westin at the San Francisco airport is a typical Westin, clean, courteous staff, standard amenities, a bit pretentious.  The hotel is taking advantage of its convenient location close to the airport and is charging top dollars for rooms that are average at best.  The stay began and ended unpleasantly: $25 for parking and breakfast not included with a $300 room - so cheap and leaving a bad taste.  The room was dimly lit by the entry hall light and the light switches for the other lights were nowhere to be found.  After tripping and fumbling five minutes in the dark the switches turned out to be knobs and push pins at the base of the bulb socket, hidden under the lamp shades, the kind you might expect in a cheap motel.  There were no outlets by the nightstand and the outlets by the desk were inaccessible unless the heavy desk was pulled away from the wall (clearly a room designed before the advent of electronic devices and never updated).  Particular to my stay, the room was located next to the elevators and the constant elevator noise kept me from finding sleep until well after midnight.
review.negativeRemarks: Update rooms with decent lighting and provide convenient outlets.  Don't nickel and dime with parking and breakfast charges - feels like a rip-off.

review.title: Nice Hotel but not your typical Westin
review.reviewText: Nice location for going to aireport. .. a little expensive when it comes to wifi and dining in the hotel but overall clean and friendly staff and would recommend to anyone travelling thru the SF airport.

review.title: Nice hotel convenient to the airport
review.reviewText: Very nice room. Updated. Clean. Parking was not included in the booking fee, which I was unaware of until checking in. My room didn't have a great view of the city, otherwise completely satisfied.

review.title: Leaving to go to the airport next am
review.reviewText: We stayed here the night before flying out after a trip to Napa and San Francisco.  Everything from bell service, to check in to the room  cleanliness,  free am  shuttle , Friendliness of the staff was perfect.   We stayed on the seventh floor in room   741.    The room was spacious clean and comfortable    And the price for one night was awesome !

hot tub - boiling hot - dangerous
caulking on tub/shower - old & mildewy

cranky front desk help

review.title: Excellent hotel except for airplane take-off noise
review.reviewText:
I'll keep this short:

I really liked this hotel and would stay here again. Staff, service, facilities and dining are excellent.

Just one thing you should be aware of: this hotel is really close to SFO airport runways and depending on the runway flights use while taking off, you can hear the jet-blast noise even with the windows/doors closed. If you are a light sleeper, this will wake you up at night. 

Otherwise, excellent stay and yes, recommended.
Nice. Nice restaurant .We only stayed one night. Friendly staff.

review.title: Poor Shuttle Service

review.title: Hotel has a terrible shuttle service
review.reviewText: The whole point of airport hotels is that they are convenient for the airport. Not the Westin SFO. I waited for an hour in the rain for the hotel shuttle -- it took an hour to go all of one mile. I could have taken BART to the city center and been in bed in that time. Rooms are nowhere near four stars either -- no sockets by the desk and last updated in the Carter Administration by the look of the drab brown rooms. They had said they would "reach out" to me when I complained about the dismal shuttle service. Not been reached yet.
review.negativeRemarks: THE SHUTTLE. Either be a convenient airport hotel or tell potential guests that in fact you are just a crap conference factory.
review.locationRemarks: Blah .... nothing nearby. Except the airport, which is an hour away if you take the hotel shuttle.

review.reviewText: The hotel facility was nice and the staffs were very helpful.  It is a dog friendly hotel.  We were greeted with dogs barking and howling as we went to our room.  We closed our door but still could hear them. The staff was nice and put us onto another floor.  Good hotel to stay if you do not mind the dogs.  We will not stay here again, just do not want to stay where animals allowed in the room.  Don't think they can guarantee the cleanliness.
review.negativeRemarks: Don't allow animals in the room.

review.title: Poorly run hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean and comfortable.  But, it's not very well run.  I had to wait an hour to get into my room because of a "computer glitch" . It was early in the morning after long flight delays; something they knew.  They charge $10 a day for internet; really, in Silicon Valley?  And, $25 a day for parking.  The staff members were friendly and the food was good.  The TV reception was poor; again, in Silicon Valley? OK, a little north of SV.  I'll look elsewhere the next time.

Maybe just us, but the items clearly marked with a charge were fine, but not a regular guest of Westin, we were not familiar with the courtesy items, so we assumed we would be charged for water and did not use it.
Very convenient from the airport . We missed the flight and booked a new one leaving at 6 in the morning. We booked Westin at the last minute, and the room was comfortable enough.

WHAT! I get both of those free at the Hampton.

Dinner was good and the lobby ambiance was nice,  Pool and hot tub were very nice.

review.reviewText: $$$$  room rates should include parking and functional internet access. It's frustrating to be nickel and dimed for "extras" with a high initial price tag.

review.reviewText: Really bad experience . We were flying out the next day to a business meeting  and my wife now have webs all over her body .

review.title: Well deserved rest

review.title: Everything Costs Extra
review.reviewText:
You think your rate is all inclusive? It's not. Parking will be an extra $25 per day and your spot is not guaranteed, as we found out one evening when the lot was full. And the scanner to get into and out of the parking lot works about half the time. That cheap continental breakfast buffet you've seen at every motel/hotel you've ever stayed in? That'll be $24 per person. Do you need to print something from a computer? You can use the internet for $5 per 10 minutes and $1 per page printed (Black and White Only). Use to hotel rooms in which walls are at least mostly soundproof? That's too bad, you'll be able to hear every whisper from the people in the next room over. 

We were under the impression we paid for a nice hotel that would charge more upfront but would make us feel welcomed and be a step about the others in return. We were wrong
review.positiveRemarks: The bed was comfortable and the TV had lots of channels and on demand things.
review.negativeRemarks: Notice of parking difficulty upfront or inclusion in the initial rate

review.reviewText: My stay was overall vefy good, except I had problems with the parking ticket and room service took a little long

Good hotel for an airport comfortable rooms. Only complaint was breakfast, hot food is not kept warm and had to request fresh/hot items, cold sausages not my preference. For lunch/light meal would recommend going to New England lobster market mins walk from hotel.

review.title: Great hotel overlooking the Bay
review.reviewText: Had a great room with a view. Room was comfortably appointed with a great king sized bed.

review.title: Close to the airport, affordable, and not too loud
review.reviewText: Even with the soundproof Windows there is still the movement of the building that creates some noise, although it wasn't enough to keep us awake. Not a lot of room for parking, especially if they're having an event that night. Other than that the stay was fine and the staff were accommodating.
Nice room helpful staff good price that about it.

review.title: A blight on the Westin Name
review.reviewText:
Shuttle from airport is rare and slow and moved through lots of parking lots before hitting the Westin.
When you arrive at such a hotel you are looking for peace and quiet: why then put the "restaurant" (?) so close to the bar that the loud drunken conversations of sports fans or people just decompressing  makes it impossible for two people to have a quiet conversation across the table without having to shout at each other.
The burger is good but why do we have to ask for mustard, mayo and ketchup after the burger is delivered? Who eats a "dry" burger? Come on!  Either create a dressing for the burger of bring the condiments by default with the food.
Room is well sound proofed but it is wildly under-lit and lacks normal amenities (sure they can be provided on demand ... but after a long flight or a full day of work I do not want to have to speak to anyone and ask for a favor.)
Our room's  air-conditioner unit was dead when we arrived (late in the night). Once we called the front desk, the unit was replaced within 30 minutes... Nice ,and efficient, but I would rather  have had a unit that worked in the first place. I would rather have slept during the time of the repair, an impossible task as we had two (very efficient and polite) workers in our room.
at midnight.
Overall: a disappointing hotel given the high level of expectation the brand Westin carries.
review.positiveRemarks: Not much, not even the location
review.negativeRemarks:
Separate restaurant and bar
Make sure all systems work in the room
More pillows
direct shuttle to Westin
review.locationRemarks: near airport... a typical airport hotel between flights or for meetings of people flying in from various corners of  the world to SFO

review.title: 10 hour layover
review.reviewText: I stayed here for a 10 hour layover and had a perfect rest between international flights. Check in was a breeze and the room was great. I ordered room service for lunch and it was fast and delicious. Great experience and left well-rested.

review.title: Bad experience in a good hotel
review.reviewText: I was put in a room (327) where I could hear an annoying elevator working that went late and started very early. My wife and I had had a long day and were in bed and noticed the elevator sounds after turning off the NFL game on TV. We put up with it because we did not want to go through the hassle of dressing, repacking and demanding another room. I am wondering if they put me in this room because I got it with my award points from Expedia? They knew I booked it that way. I have had rooms with no views, at the ends of long hallways etc. and wondered if it was because I used Expedia. But have had great rooms, too.
review.positiveRemarks: Overall fine hotel but was put in a noisy room.
review.negativeRemarks: Do not know if they can do anything since it is part of the main construction.

review.title: Nice hotel near airport
review.reviewText: Experience was OK.  Beds were too soft.  Requested a room with a king bed and received a room with two double beds.  Hotel in very good condition.
review.positiveRemarks: Reasonable price in a good location.
review.negativeRemarks: Beds were too soft.  Not good if you prefer a very firm bed for sleeping.
review.locationRemarks: Plenty to do in SF.  Great place to vacation.

review.reviewText: Beautiful facility. Really nice pool and hot tub. Very good value.

review.title: Great Stay
review.reviewText: We were tired from a long drive from Los Angeles to San Francisco and anticipated an issue with our room (see below).  We arrived at checkin and were helped immediately with no issues, staff was friendly and very accommodating. review.title: Convenient location - free shuttle to airport!
review.reviewText:
Overall, the Westin San Francisco Airport is a pleasant hotel to stay at. 

The free shuttle to and from the airport is a huge advantage.  The shuttle schedule is frequent (between 10 - 20 min/bus depending on the time of day).  I believe there are at least 2 shuttle buses running at all times. 
There is free wi-fi in the main lobby. 

The nearest BART station is Millbrae, which is an easy 15 min walk from the hotel.  Or, you can take the free shuttle to the airport and take the BART from the airport.  From Millbrae station to downtown SF is about 30 min at $4.85/adult. From the airport to downtown SF is about 25 min at $8.65/adult (one less stop but added fare because of security costs).  At night, if alone, I would use the airport station + free shuttle if only because the 15 min walk is pretty empty (the area is suburban sprawl).  There are some restaurants within walking distance.  

My only complaint are the thin walls.  I am a deep sleeper but the walls are pretty thin - I could hear my neighbours hollering at each other during an early check-out, staff in the hallways, and at one point, I woke to someone else's cell phone alarm.  Surprisingly, I was never bothered by any noise from the airport. If you have an early flight, this is an ideal hotel to stay at.  If you want to sleep in, you may find it a bit noisy.
review.positiveRemarks:
*friendly and helpful staff.
*very clean and spacious (huge!) rooms (with free coffee and tea). 
*noon check-out.
review.negativeRemarks: *walls are too thin - I could hear all my neighbours and noise in the hallways.

review.title: Convenient to SFO for early morning departure
review.reviewText: Our family stayed at the Westin because of a 5:45AM departure from SFO. It is one of the closest in the area to the airport, and their shuttle service (seemingly a sub-contracted service) begins at 4:00AM, which was a relief. Shuttle was right on time, and the driver could not have been more helpful. We noticed that several airlines seem to use the Westin for their crew layovers. We had an excellent meal at the in-hotel restaurant, Grill and Vine. My son gave high marks to the exercise/fitness facility as well. Check-in was expedient; valet kindly held our rental car (for a nominal fee) for thirty minutes while we got settled, and I then returned the rental car to the Airport Rental Car Center. We had a great walk on the linear park across from the hotel- excellent for a quick run or stroll along the Bay, with great views of planes landing and taking off from SFO, and at night, the lights of the East Bay. We all were impressed with the "green" environmental approach of the Westin- not something one finds in many other hotels, but this is improving.
review.negativeRemarks: The logistics of returning a rental car and then getting back to the hotel. Could there possibly be shuttle service directly from the rental center?

review.title: Excellent Airport Hotel
review.reviewText: This is probably one of the best airport hotels we have used.  My only complaint is that we could hear the pipes in the bathroom when people in the rooms above and below us were using the water.  Not a banging sound of air in the pipes just the ordinary sound of water running through the pipes but louder than we've ever heard anywhere else.  We didn't have to be in the bathroom to hear it.  We could hear it out in the room when we were watching t.v., etc.  Seems to me there should be more insulation in the floors and walls or something to prevent that.  Apart from that it, is really a very nice notel, nice room, furnishings, etc. and excellent service an the part of all the hotel staff members.

review.title: Relaxing and Convenient!
review.reviewText: The Westin San Fransisco Airport provided a great afternoon/evening/night of much-needed rest and relaxation.  My husband and I had gone on a camping trip and needed somewhere to stay before our flight out the next morning.  The Westin SFO was easy to book (via Expedia).  Checking in was just as easy.  The room was luxurious and amenities were excellent - especially for the price.  We enjoyed a great dinner (I ordered the Cioppini!) in the comfort of the hotel.  In the morning, we were greeted with fresh brewed coffee and a free shuttle to SFO.  The shuttle runs every 15 minutes until 9:00AM - then you can catch it every 30 minutes.  The driver was helpful and courteous and made the transition easy and stress-free.  I will definitely visit this hotel next time I am in the area!

review.title: Hotel has an A for convenience but bad service
review.reviewText: Booked a room that mentioned online king or double beds. Asked at check in for a king, was checked into room with double beds. Came back down right after seeing the room and it was told to me that king rooms were negative and they had an Ada room available. Well it's next to the elevator... I understand that is due to convenience but it is really loud. The ada shower head would not hold up and it was difficult to take a shower. Called room service to order a burger and wings around 10:45pm. Ordered it medium rare... Burger had no pink in it at all and was cooked all the way through. My lady wanted a kit Kat.... So I asked the operator and it was relayed to me they would be unable to get any candy for me as it was in the gift shop and the shop was closed. However if I wanted a candy I would need to come down to the lobby... This is not very service oriented. So, as I had no option to get the candy... I got dressed late at night and headed downstairs. After waiting in line at the front I asked the lady, as there was no one behind me, if someone could let me into the gift shop. She told me that they "were busy and I would have to wait for a manager. It would just be easier if I walked to the Loft!" Meanwhile the manager was at the terminal to her left and on the computer with no guest in front of him. After I told her that I did not want to walk to the loft I stepped aside and waited a couple of minutes before she even tried to contact a manager... took forever to get.

review.title: Not quite 4 stars
review.reviewText: After staying at many 4 Star hotels, I must admit The Westin San Francisco Airport was a disappointment. Upon arrival there were no bellmen offering carts for checkin. After asking to view the room in advance, we were told that the manager would have to walk with us. I have made this request at numerous 4 Star hotels in the past and have never had to be escorted. The room appeared clean and tidy although more align to a standard room in contrast to the deluxe bay view promise. After checking in, we decided to go site seeing. We asked for the Concierge desk and were shockingly told that it was the handled by the doorman. I was then directed to go outside in the wind, where the doorman suggested I take out my smartphone and use that. REALLY??? That evening, we returned to find both Valet and self park were FULL. To their credit the front desk apologized and offered to comp our vallet for the remainder of our 3day stay. This would have been nice had we not found out upon checkout that we had been charged anyway. We then explained what events had led up to the front desk offer and were questioned as to who we spoke with and that no notes had been made on our account. After a brief investigation the charges were reversed. Sadly, we will not return to this hotel. Our daughter will be attending SF State in the fall and we were looking forward to many visits. Hopefully this experience will not represent any of the other Westin establishments.
review.positiveRemarks: We loved the indoor pool and lobby atmosphere.
review.negativeRemarks: A Concierge desk should be standard and it should be located inside the lobby. Hotel guest should not have to go outside for assistance,

review.title: Nice hotel close to the airport
review.reviewText: It was very nice to be there. I enjoyed a comfortable night.

Reserved and paid rooms through expedia. I specifically asked for rooms to be close, even reminded check in clerk. He said he would try his best. The two rooms were on two different halls, one allllll the way at end of hall. 
Overnight parking is 24$ a night, yet its soo packed, you have to fight for parking or park in front of other cars.
The shower head was leaky in one of the rooms.

review.title: Ellie review
review.reviewText: We were in town to attend a function in Burlingame.  We chose the Westin to spend the night  The check went well, the room was clean and spacious.  There was an unexpected expense of $23 per day to park your vehicle.  The parking spaces are limited especially late in the evening.
review.positiveRemarks: The comfortable bed and pillows and its location.  We were able to get the hotel deal and therefore making it very affordable.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the city of Burlingame and to San Francisco City.

review.reviewText: Great hotel overall, convenient to airport and getting up and down the peninsula for work. The staff was very friendly and the room was clean, comfortable and well equipped.
review.negativeRemarks: The only negative I can point out is the airplane noise, but obviously that comes with the territory of being near the airport & my room faced runway

review.title: Noisy hotel
review.reviewText:
The hotel is next to SFO runway take off end.  This is where the planes do their run up before they rev up the jet engines for take off.  You can imagine the noisy and the rumble it creates.  The  rooms are clean and the facilities are clean.  We had a bad experience with the service.  On our second day our e-keys did not work and was told flat out at the front desk that the room is not occupied.  After further investigation and convincing the issue was resolved with no apology.
Hard to believe this hotel is a Westin Hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Sensitivity training for the staff.  Investigate first before stating that a guest is not telling the truth.
review.locationRemarks: Bad location, parking and Internet have a charge.

review.title: Westin Hotel SF Airport
review.reviewText: Rooms were nice, parking lot was full so there was nowhere to park, hot tub broken and I reserved bay view but didn't get one. Staff wasn't very friendly and bar singer was terrible

review.title: EXCELLENT ACCOMMODATIONS
review.reviewText: I found this hotel to be quite nice and convenient.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing.
review.locationRemarks: No comment.

review.title: Wonderful  stay
review.reviewText: Clean friendly and great food and atmosphere.  I definitely stay there again and OMG the bed is soooo  comfortable
SFO. Airport. Ended up staying 2 nights due to snow in Boston and flight cx
review.locationRemarks: Short shuttle ride to terminals.  Took a cab to Kincaids restaurant in Burlingame for very good dinner.

review.title: Very nice place!
review.reviewText: Really nice place, has nice pool and restaurants, but the staff were disorganised when I arrived and many people were frustrated. Seems to me like they work for tips, not to provide good service.
review.negativeRemarks: They were pretty disorganised upon arrival. Only one door man, wanted me to leave my luggage unattended while I went to park my car.
review.locationRemarks: Really conveniently located right of Hwy101 and close to the airport.

review.title: Close to the airport
review.reviewText: Nice and quite for a airport hotel. Only a short distance to the airport with shuttle.
review.positiveRemarks: Location location and the fact that the hotel had a full bar on site...
review.locationRemarks: Airport

review.title: Airport hotel
review.reviewText: I have never had a bad experience with Westin but this was bad.     Started with not being able to cool the room, which stayed at about 75.    Thermostat was also in celsius which was really puzzling.     Shower handle fell off when turning on & off, towel rack was broken and fell off the wall and the lamp next to the bed was broken.    It was actually comical.     However the desk and restaurant staff were very friendly.     I do recommend the hotel due to its proximity to the airport and friendly staff and also I'm going to assume they will fix the room shortfalls since we told the front desk about them.
review.positiveRemarks: convenience to the airport and friendly staff
review.negativeRemarks: They need to have the housekeeping mgr check the rooms more frequently
review.locationRemarks: Close to airport.     Not sure there's anything to do nearby.

review.title: Westin Has Improved Over Time
review.reviewText: I choose the Westin for its easy access to the Mildrae BART station (so I could get in and out of San Francisco without driving) and the SF Airport.  The property is also accros the street from the SF Bay.   I had no problems with anything.
review.positiveRemarks: It seems to me that the hotel has improves in the past 20 years.  The restaurant is much, much better, for example, and the shop off of the entrance i
review.negativeRemarks: Too late to soundproof the rooms.  You do hear planes coming and going.  Stop charging $23 per night for self-parking, and $15 per day for wireless.
review.locationRemarks: Several excellent restaurants just down Airport Boulevard.  Many more, plus shops, etc., in nearby downtown Milbrae.

review.title: Overnight pre-flight
review.reviewText:
great for an overnight stay before flying out
shuttle bus works fine except going SFO to Hotel you get on the bus at the departures level not at arrivals/baggage claim

review.title: Convenient Location Only
review.reviewText: Easy access to Bart, SFO, Hwy 101, and Burlingame. Price of food inside hotel, as well as the cost of parking are unconscionable.  $23 per 24 hrs for self parking.  Bart parking is only 3 to 4 blocks away, costs much, much less and there is shuttle service available.  The parking is not controlled by the Westin.  It's shared with some business next door.  The people that hang out in the parking adjacent to the hotel, and seem to be in charge, look less than trustworthy.  Bad vibe in the parking lot.
review.negativeRemarks: Second sink in bathroom.

review.title: Noisy sheets. Expensive self parking.
review.reviewText: Noisy sheets. Expensive parking.  Claim to have many items for you in case you have forgotten something but did not have feminine products and did not call back to tell me so... I had to call the front desk a second time.
review.negativeRemarks: cheaper parking

review.title: Another reliable Westin
review.reviewText: You know what you get every time you stay at a westin and this is no different. Clean, well appointed rooms, bright and efficient staff, lots of convenience. In fact, this is a very convenient location when staying in SF.   There is no view to speak of and the restaurant downstairs is only ok. Still, I would recommend this to a friend and stay again!

review.title: Nice hotel with easy access to airport and dining.
review.reviewText: We stayed 2 nights and had a nice stay. It was decorated nicely for the Holidays. The only thing I would change is the overhead music. They have grand pianos all around but we had to listen to loud, obnoxious music that teenagers might prefer.

review.title: Best location near SFO
review.reviewText: Great location for an overnight stay, it needs some updates in the rooms mostly the the bathrooms. We enjoyed the swimming pool since it was heated, my 3 year old got to swim over an hour which was wonderful. The breakfast buffet is average, the only bad part is that there isn't many restaurant choices around.

review.title: Close to the Airport
review.reviewText: Because it is close to the airport, it is a little noisy. They charge $23/day for parking and also charge for Wi-Fi in the room, but it is free in the lobby. The restaurant in the hotel is expensive, but there are several inexpensive options nearby on El  Camino if you have a car.  The hotel staff were very friendly. The park across the street from the hotel is a nice place to walk or run.

review.title: Nice hotel close to Air port
review.reviewText:
Excellent hotel with very good lobby and clean room,  Only issue is the when checking in, only one staff is handling this in the beginning. So we wait in QUeue for some time.
Though close to airport, it is still quite in room and we have good sleep.

review.title: Nice Hotel, great price, but disappointing service
review.reviewText: I had selected the King bed rooms specifically for both of our rooms.  when we checked in, they gave both of them as double beds.  after extensive argument with the front lobby, they managed to wave the parking fee, but still no king bed.   don't bother making a room selection as they will only give you what they have.

review.title: Decent Hotel for an Overnight Stay
review.reviewText: Check in was easy.  Room was smaller than I expected.  We were given a handicap accessible room although we didn't request one. Bed was super comfy.
review.positiveRemarks: I really liked the young lady at the front desk who checked us in.  She was friendly and quite humorous.
review.negativeRemarks: Drink specials in the hotel bar.
review.locationRemarks: 5 minutes by complimentary shuttle; shares parking lot and other amenities with Aloft hotel

review.title: Nice hotel by airport but not for dog lovers
review.reviewText: Hotel is nice and room was nice sized.  You do get some airplane noise but nothing that distracted from sleep.  Avoid if you are allergic to dogs.  There were so many people with dogs as this hotel is pet friendly.

review.title: Catching up with wife flying in from overseas.
review.reviewText: Came in before the with. We had a 7am flight out to JFK so decided to stay close to airport. Room is very comfortable. Shower was hot. Room was very clean. Checkin fast. Shuttle is every 15 min and runs most of the late night. Location is great but limited to what is around Hotel. Use maps to find a great seafood place and also bakery close by. Great bayside park across the street.
Dog friendly, close to the airport, entire family enjoyed.
review.negativeRemarks: none
review.locationRemarks: airport was pretty close.

review.reviewText: Checked in late, at same time as several flight crew. While I got to front desk first, front desk clerk ignored me, and opted to help them first. I was grateful to the pilot who finally suggested he would wait while I was checked in. Clerk was less than efficient, but upgraded my room, offered late check out, and was fairly friendly once she acknowledged me. Room was too warm (thermostat said 65...but don't think it was accurate), but I was unable to adjust equipment to make cooler...frustrating

review.title: Room smelled of a prior occupant's smoking.
review.reviewText:
This is a hard smell to get rid of, but it was really strong, suggesting little effort had been expended.  Of course, when my neighbors lit up some skunk weed, the cigarette smell fell quickly into the background.  They had a great time until about midnight.  Unfortunately, I needed to get up at 6.

Also, you can hear the planes taking off.  Other airport hotels, for example, the Marriot IN the Detroit airport, are silent.

review.title: $23.00 parking
review.reviewText: Didn't like the fact that the hotel had a parking fee of $23.00

review.title: Not worth the "Bay View" upgrade
review.reviewText: "Nice" hotel... little worse for wear as far as a Westin goes.  Paid for the "Bay View" upgrade and it was a view of the parking lot from the fourth floor with water off in the distance.  Parking, even if you do it yourself is $23/night which I found steep when valet was $30/night.  Visit was decent...

review.title: Good price, but ...
review.reviewText: Found a good deal, but AC turned off overnight making it warm & uncomfortable.  Then AC started working in the morning, so it felt like staff remotely turned it off.
review.negativeRemarks: Do not turn off AC remotely overnight
review.locationRemarks: Short drive to San Francisco downtown

review.reviewText: The hotel is a great location when you are catching an early flight from SF International.  he hotel offers a convenient free, on-time shuttle service to and from the airport.  The Westin  SF Airport check-in service is customer oriented and efficient. The hotel is well maintained with a fine dining area that accommodates all ages.  Starbucks is available in the lobby which is a plus for "serious" coffee drinkers. The rooms are well appointed and comfortable. The bed at a Westin always provides a restful sleep. .

review.title: Super nice Hotel
review.reviewText:
great staff, food, room service, breakfast buffet, pool area!
Wonderful stay!
I was amazed that I couldn't hear the roar of the jets from inside.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Had a breif, but enjoyable night at the Westin.  Close to the airport, BART and Caltrain which makes the Bay Area accessible.  Service was great, breakfast in the restaurant was very tasty and just a great, relaxed time.  Good value especially when compared to downtown San Francisco.  If comfort is important to you, I recommend.  If location matters more, I'd still recommend on value, but you may waqnt to check the tourist options they may have.
review.negativeRemarks: Shuttle to the train station?
review.locationRemarks: Location is near the airport - so the to do list is a bit limitied.

review.title: Expected more from a Westin
review.reviewText:
Info on Expedia about rollaway beds being a fire hazard for rooms with double beds is not accurate. I would not have booked and prepaid if I had known. Women at front desk for check in was rude and condescending. She said that they were "not responsible' for what Expedia says about their hotel. I would argue that Westin IS responsible for what is said about their hotel on other sites. I don't care what site I book it on, I'm staying at YOUR hotel. 

Construction was also very loud.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff

review.title: over-nite close to airport
review.reviewText:
Staff was very accommodating I got an early check in 8am . Shuttle to air port every 15 min .
Nice Bar in lobby. Nice linens and clean comfy room. I will defiantly stay again
review.positiveRemarks:
Shuttle to air port every 15 min .
Nice Bar in lobby. Nice linens and clean comfy room.

review.title: Exceeded my expectations of Expedia and Westin!
review.reviewText:
Everything was amazing,  will definitely ues Expedia again and stay at the Westin when by SFO.
Awesome Thank You

review.title: Not Bad.
review.reviewText:
Everything was okay, and i would definitely recommend it to a friend, but put in your mind the following:
1- early morning airplane across the street taking off every minute, causing a some small vibration noise, no sounds tho. 
2- a huge disappointment was parking, parking area is crowded and somewhat expensive, i would consider an inner San Francisco hotel if i knew the cost of parking is (23$), it would be the same value but much closer to the city attraction.
review.locationRemarks:
Have your breakfast at Panera, 1 minute drive. the hotel breakfast is overpriced. 
Safeway store is close-by.

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: Excellent location when flying out of SFO and staff was very nice. Was disappointed in room conditions..was rather small and bottles of water inside room are a charge. The bathroom had wear issues and the bed sheets looked very used.

review.title: Noisy, slow service
review.reviewText: Slow service. Can hear next door room clearly- very noisy, toilet flushing.

review.title: Close to airport!
review.reviewText: We had an early flight so we stayed at Westin. The beds are amazing and the quality of the rooms met my high expectations.

review.title: THE MOST COMFORTABLE BED
review.reviewText: I was exhausted and it was late, coming from Kona and had to depart within 6 hours of my arrival for a connecting flight, the shuttle service was very handy, the restaurant had gluten free selections and KIM Crawford Sauvignon Blanc, my favourite, and the bed was to die for, told a friend who also had stayed there and he said he liked the bed so much he bought one.

review.title: Great SFO airport hotel.
review.reviewText: Staff was very professional and polite.  Room was very clean and comfortable. In fact, it was probably the most comfortable bed I ever slept in at a hotel.

review.title: restful stay
review.reviewText: A gym, a pool, a restaurant on the premise - easy to "stay in" with everything right there. A restful nights sleep. A great launching point to SFO - Westin has an airport shuttle.
review.positiveRemarks: Felt welcomed. A helpful and courteous front desk.
review.negativeRemarks: bath / shower tile grout needed cleaning attention

review.title: Nice hotel close to the airport
review.reviewText: Nice room and had an indoor pool- great for the kids!

Nice hotel, but doesn't have any of the basics that you would expect from one.

For example, you have to pay for wifi in the room, breakfast, parking. I expected these things so was disappointed when the Westin did not deliver.

review.title: Way too noisy
review.reviewText:
Very noisy. Right by the airport so you feel k
Like the planes r landing on the roof. The windows shake 
So many better hotels in this area. Choose another one. We will!
Room was clean.  Could use some upgrades.  Very close to airport which was nice.  Our room overlooked the airport.  Did not hear too many planes.  Would recommend the bay view rooms.

review.title: night at the airport before an early flight
review.reviewText: There was a long line (10+ people) at check in and only one clerk to assist all those people. ALL of them. They needed at least one more clerk but nobody came to help out. Safeway has better customer service! The toilet kept flushing all night long. European duvet-style bedding was very heavy and way too hot. The housekeeping carts stayed in the hall all night, which is unsightly and made it hard to wheel luggage to and from our room. Room was quiet (except for the toilet) but I would pick any other airport hotel instead of this one next time. Not at all what I expected from a name brand like the Westin.
review.negativeRemarks: Fix the plumbing. Get more people at registration. Replace the bedding with something that doesn't weight 93,000,000 pounds and that's not so hot.

review.title: Housecleaning
review.reviewText: Had two rooms booked through Expedia. Neither was cleaned after first night's stay. Only there two nights.

review.title: Excellent hotel when flying out of SFO
review.reviewText: Hotel is nice and typical of a Westin.  It also has a free shuttle to the airport, which leaves frequently.
review.negativeRemarks: Free Wifi

review.reviewText: Incredibly comfortable (and quiet) lodging, even though it's just a few minutes from San Francisco International Airport.  Their airport shuttles are also reliable and convenient.  Westin wonderful!
Very comfortable food and drinks were also delicious

review.title: Contemporary hotel with easy access
review.reviewText: The environment was nice and the staff were very helpful. The room had a nice view and was clean and comfortable. I ate breakfast there one of the days and it was good. Only drawback was few outlets for plugging in electronics and you have to pay for internet.
I will never use Expedia or the Westin again . This is a redacted review because Expedia censors any negative reviews of their business .

review.title: Great hotel, expensive parking and internet.
review.reviewText: This hotel is super nice and in a great area. This part of the bay is my favorite. I got to the hotel after a bicycle ride and the person at the counter was friendly but looked at me like I was not able to afford my room. The parking was almost $25 and DOES have in and out privileges. The internet at this hotel is pricey at $15, but works really well. I loved the super soft beds and really cool rain shower.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking could be cheaper and internet could be much more affordable.
review.locationRemarks: At the end of the runway at SFO. There is a park across the street, and Bart over the freeway. IN and out over the freeway too.

review.title: It's no Venetian Hotel
review.reviewText: Dirty shower that didn't drain, TV didn't work. Paid for a deluxe room, nothing deluxe about it. You can hear and feel planes going over.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleaning and be sure TV's are working

review.title: Expensive for the quality
review.reviewText:
We drove in from San Jose to stay the night because we had a very early flight in the morning. We checked in and left our luggage to be taken to our room while we returned a rental car.  We returned in about 45 minutes and our luggage was still not in our room.  I had to call twice to finally get it.

Service at the hotel was slow, we were told it was a 30 minute wait so we went back to our room.  When we got back to the restaurant people were just walking in and taking tables without putting name on list, we felt that was bad management.  Those folks were getting served before we were.  Seemed understaffed.

Pretty pricy and the room was mediocre.  Won't stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff appropriately.

review.title: Nice Hotel close to  SFO.
review.reviewText: Nice Hotel a short drive from SFO. No Airline noise We had dinner in the Hotel restaurant and it was quite good!

review.title: Comfortable, clean, friendly
review.reviewText: Great hotel! Spotless and comfortable. The staff was so sweet and very accommodating.

review.title: Great location, great staff
review.reviewText: Emergency stay because my mom got sick on the plane landing in SFO. Booking and hotel staff were super. Peaceful place for a harried treveller.

review.title: Westin San Francisco
review.reviewText: Accommodations were nice, have to pay for parking, and internet access. Friendly staff

review.title: Nice but you have to pay for WiFi and Parking
review.reviewText: Nice hotel close to airport but not a bargain.   Had to pay for WiFi and $23 a night to park.   Would not stay here again for the price.
review.positiveRemarks: The room and bathroom were nice.  The indoor pool was beautiful.
review.negativeRemarks: Include WiFi and parking.
review.locationRemarks: Great restaurant called "New England Lobster" within walking distance.

review.title: Hotel was nice
review.reviewText: Did not like the fact there was a $23 charge for parking my rental vehicle overnight. I won't be staying there again. I have stayed at other hotels there and not had to pay for parking.

Cleanliness of the room, was not the best.
Even though that we are two people, we had only one robe.
The elevator smell like an ashtray.
review.negativeRemarks:
Cleanliness of the room.
Even though that we are two people, we had only one robe.
The elevator smell like an ashtray.

review.title: It was a very nice hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice. For the price, almost 400 for the room, I expected to at least have a cart to bring up my luggage, and possible a porter to help out.  The check in desk never asked if we needed help with luggage.  The also charged 23 to park our car for the night, which seems kind of odd to me.     It was clean and comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: help with luggage, maybe carts or a porter ? signs to tell where the elevators are.
review.locationRemarks: close to the airport, which turned out to be great for us. our flight was delayed and we got on to another, but had to be at the airport in 30 mins !!

review.title: Horrible Staff!
review.reviewText:
I asked to be moved to a different room per loud neighbors, took almost a half hour to do so, with no one calling me to let me know it was being worked on. I had to call to ask status... To sum it up the manager justin cooper made it seem like it was my fault for why I was upset and offered to only comp. my parking which was 23$.

Will never stay here again
Easy commute to and from the airport and easy access to The Bart train for transportation into San Francisco.

review.title: OKish hotel--if you're not particular
review.reviewText:
If you are just looking for a place to sleep in between meetings or flights, this place is a good place to stay. It has a dedicated shuttle from the airport to both its sites, the staff is friendly and respects your privacy, etc.

However, if you are looking for something of an experience in return for the kind of price points involved in a booking here, it leaves much to be desired. 

The bar at the Westin itself has great staff, they are great at customer service, make drinks well, etc. It's just that few of the patrons actually go there. The mark up at a bar is generally validated by the social experience--the bar/restaurant here is just an expensive way to drink or eat alone.

Aesthetically, it doesn't really try. It just has a sort of generic "spa" feel that is more or less limited to the fact that it has a something like a rain shower and the types of toiletries offered. You don't get the impression that a great amount of effort was put into thinking through a guest experience.

They also charge for EVERYTHING. If I'm paying a price for a room that could get me a house rental somewhere in the Bay Area for the same amount of time, I expect at least the same amenities that a 2 star hotel would have--like complimentary internet. But, no, if you want to read your email on your laptop and you don't have a personal hotspot, there will be an additional--and kind of steep--daily charge.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was friendly and it had an OK vibe.
review.negativeRemarks: I was there during the weekend of a major event and the place seemed understaffed. They had roughly 1 person to deal with the guests.
review.locationRemarks: It's sort of isolated--if you don't have a car, the only place that you can get to without making your own arrangements is the other resort site.

review.title: Close to the BART which takes you  downtown
review.reviewText: The bed was very comfortable. You can't hear any of the planes despite the hotel being next to the airport. I didn't like ththat there was a fee for wifi and parking. There's free parking at the milbrae BART station on saturdays and sundays. There's a small fee to park there Monday-Friday, but it's way better than paying for parking at the Westin.
review.negativeRemarks: Free paring and wifi
review.locationRemarks: There's an in-n-out and panera bread that's a ten minute walk away

review.title: Everything was great but the toilet can flush fast
review.reviewText: great hotel but the toilet can flush faster... friendly staff nice resto

review.title: Very convenient to San Francisco Airport.
review.reviewText: Free shuttle to airport.  Very convenient to San Francisco Airport.  Arrived late and left early.  Did not use the various services provided by hotel.

review.title: Beautiful hotel with great views
review.reviewText: Our check-in was fast and the staff was excellent.  I will definitely stay at this hotel every time I need to stay near the SFO Airport.  There is convenient shuttle service to the airport and it is convenient to the BART station as well.  The room was spotless and the beds were great!

review.title: great hotel if you need to be close to the airport
review.reviewText: great hotel, not much around within walking distance except other hotels. The bay is across the street which has a nice walking path. We chose this hotel since we needed to be close to the airport due to our travel plans
review.positiveRemarks: the business center was great, clean and the staff was great and very helpful
review.negativeRemarks: more resturants
review.locationRemarks: not much.. the bay walking path is great

review.title: Great pool, bathrooms not cleaned well
review.reviewText: I thoroughly enjoyed the pool.  The lobby staff were very helpful and the check-in was smooth and pleasant.   Unfortunately, after swimming I went back to my new room to wash my hair and I found the bathtub had short dark hair around the drain.  I phoned for assistance.  I believe my call went to the gift shop.  I was told someone would call me back about it.  After waiting more than twenty minutes I went to the front desk.  They were very apologetic, gave me a key for a different room and a breakfast buffet comp.  So I moved my luggage to the new room and went in to take a shower.  Again, dirty bathtub, this one was worse.  I went downstairs.  The night hotel manager came with me and he checked my room.  He was very eager to rectify the situation to my satisfaction.  He took pictures of the bathtub and some other things he was unhappy about and said he would be using them for re-training his housekeeping staff.  I was too tired to change rooms again so I had the manager send housekeeping to clean and disinfect the tub.  By the time I got into the shower my hair had already dried from the pool.  I don't like chlorine in my hair.
review.positiveRemarks: Pool was great, the lobby staff and ambiance were very nice.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness.
review.locationRemarks: I took a long walk near the ocean.

review.reviewText: The greeter in the hotel restaurant was very helpful and nice.

review.title: Great hotel.  Loved it.
review.reviewText: The Westin San Francisco Airport is an excellent stay.  Most comfortable room I've had in many months.  Everything worked, the TV REMOTE WAS RESPONSIVE!  Can you believe that?!?!  None of that 2 second, 3 second delay between channels.  Bed was comfy and the breakfast was good, but a tad expensive.  ($22.00 for a buffet breakfast?)
review.positiveRemarks: The TV Remote.  The soft bed.  The clean, working shower.
review.negativeRemarks: Not the TV remote.  I can tell you that, boy howdy!
review.locationRemarks: The room was in the hotel and there was an ottoman by a chair.  The telephone was by the bed.  I watched TV, slept and ate breakfast!  Awesome.

review.title: lost my bag and they couldn't do to help
review.reviewText: very good as they couldn't do to much to help me luck was on my side and it was found. Only very slight downside is that is very close to the airport, it is noise proofed but you can just hear the planes taking off,but not enough to disturb anything.The complimentary bus is very good and runs every 15 mins  would use this hotel again.
review.locationRemarks:
can get taxi to San Fransico but cost $60
get taxi to rapid train $10 and get into town that way much cheaper and more fun.

review.reviewText: Nice hotel. Only issues were loud constant low level hum from fans or some mechanical origin. Vacuumed halls early in morning. Also shower was clogged.

review.title: This was a perfect out of town hotel
review.reviewText: We used the free shuttle to the airport Bart station daily where we got the train into city centre. There is also a nice walk across from the hotel and you can watch planes landing and taking off from the extremely busy airport. Hotel is totally soundproof and we were there during the recent earthquake and the staff were just wonderful to alay our fears. Couldn't find fault at all!

review.title: Convenient and very nice for early flight
review.reviewText: Shuttle service a big plus.  Top notch service   Pool area relaxing.  Staff friendly.

review.title: Nice location
review.reviewText: Situated near SFO airport, like really you can walk, if you feel like it. Staff were very helpful and polite. Close to free way so you can drive to down town in a breeze. Lastly , its a pet friendly hotel. I love this place

review.title: Rest in SFO
review.reviewText:
I stayed at the Westin San Francisco airport after attending a busy conference in Sacramento before returning back home to New Zealand. The whole experience was fabulous and in sharp contrast to my previous days in Sacramento. All staff were courteous and made some practical and positive suggestions to make my stay a good one. I was welcomed in the restaurant even though I was a lone diner - this I appreciated. The room was comfortable and in particular, the bath robe provided was of generous proportions. 
The courtesy shuttle service provided meant getting back to the airport was easy. The driver in particular should be congratulated on his courtesy and service - making sure that my luggage was carefully stowed and insisting that he carry it off the shuttle for me. Top Marks all round.
review.positiveRemarks: It was friendly and welcoming. The attractive and comfortable lounge lobby are and the small shop was an added bonus.

review.reviewText: Perfect stay, no complaints, lovely hotel, quiet and clean.

review.title: Convenient & Good Cuisine
review.reviewText: A good & quiet stop over at the SFO area.  The cuisine in the restaurant is exceptional good !
review.negativeRemarks: Housekeeping keeps knocking our door early in the morning...
review.locationRemarks: Beach trail is a good way to jog in the morning.

review.title: Close to airport.
review.reviewText:
It's a shuttle ride and then a train ride into the city from this hotel.  The hotel is beautiful though, even if quite a way out of town.  Gets a bit expensive at $8.50 per person each way. 
The shuttle timetable is available and you get the train at the International airport.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Not sure what is nearby other than the airport.

review.title: Good for flying out of SFO
review.reviewText: This hotel is clean and the staff tries to please but the  price is steep for what you get.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice room, quiet AC and good shower
review.negativeRemarks: Bang for the buck was not there
review.locationRemarks: Next to SFO, good for that early flight out

review.title: Stay in the Westin before a morning flight
review.reviewText: It was a very pleasant experience in the hotel and highly recommend it for someone who has an early morning flight out of SF.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, view of runway mas the gym
review.locationRemarks: It is just good for a morning flight.  If you go to SF for vacation, stay in the city.

review.title: One night stay waiting for my flight next morning.
review.reviewText: Quality hotel with pleasant staff that is conveniently located near SFO with shuttle to and from the airport.
review.positiveRemarks: Quiet and close to the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: I was satisfied as is.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the airport makes it excellent for air travelers.

review.title: Nice Hotel close to SF airport
review.reviewText:
I stayed there on a single night visit to San Francisco. It is very near to the airport and is easily accessible and they also provide complimentary round trip airport shuttle service for their guests. I really liked the hotel ambience and the lobby looked inviting. The reception staff was very helpful and accommodated our early check-in and late check-out requests without any questions or hassles.
They also have a pool which I thought gave a tropical feel and looked well maintained. We stayed in a Deluxe King room and I really liked the room. The best feature was the rain shower head! The airport is very close to the hotel and you can see planes landing and taking off. I am sure the hotel rooms are soundproof as we could not hear any noise from the planes flying all the time.
We had a very peaceful stay and a good night's sleep! I would go back again for sure.
It was fit for the purpose, which was to crash for the night and move on.  Nothing fantastic, but very good.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to the airport, frequent shuttles.
review.negativeRemarks: What is with the hordes twenty (?  Younger?) something's dragging plastic bags of clothes around the hotel at midnight?
review.locationRemarks: Fly away

review.title: Everything you expect from a Westin Hotel.
review.reviewText: We stayed overnight to catch an early flight. The hotel was quiet, clean and we got a great night sleep before our busy day. It was very quiet which we appreciated after our week in the noisy city.

review.title: Great easy and fabulous
review.reviewText: I was tired it was good and clean relaxing and perfect

review.title: Great for Travelers.
review.reviewText: Overall great experience.  Only stayed for one night before next day early morning flight.  Check-in was easy, price was excellent for the room.  Room as clean, although seemed a little cramped.  Bed was comfortable and bathroom was nice and updated.  $20 for parking at the hotel was a little extreme.  Location to airport was perfect.  Room was really quiet - only noise came from the hallway from rude guests & slamming doors.  Could not hear anything between rooms or from outside.  Very positive experience - will definitely consider next time in town.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable room/bed/bathroom.  Quiet room.  Easy location to airport.
review.negativeRemarks: $20 to park at hotel is too extreme.  $15 for wireless access is ridiculous to charge - this should be free.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect for anyone who is using the airport.  Easy access to major cities (San Fran, Oakland, San Jose).

review.title: A perfect one night stay after a two week vacation
review.reviewText: A perfect martini, a perfect big fluffy bed and a perfect 10 minute ride to the airport.

review.title: Clean and close to everything in SF
review.reviewText:
Enjoyed our stay, would recommend this hotel , even though you can see the airport from the room we slept well and noise was minimum.
Room service good , staff really nice .

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: They are 4 legs friendly which is very nice as we always travel with our 2 babies

review.title: Ok but small rooms for the price.
review.reviewText: The lobby area and public areas are quite nice.  The double room that we stayed in was rather small and could use a make over.

review.title: Nice hotel close to airport
review.negativeRemarks: none
review.locationRemarks: I don't know

review.title: Great Hotel near the airport
review.reviewText: Check in was easy,staff friendly. The room was comfortable and clean. The food was great.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff were friendly and the bed was comfortable,there was a pool. The food was great.
review.locationRemarks: It was at the airport and nothing was nearby

review.title: What a hotel should be
review.reviewText:
We flew in close to midnight and the Westin shuttle was already at the airport. The driver loaded our bags and got us to  the hotel quick enough that we had time to check in and have a cold draft beer before last call. Happiness! Started our vacation right. Our room was clean, spacious,  and very comfortable.
We had the buffet breakfast and leisurely read complimentary newspapers in the comfortable cushioned chairs. 
The staff was very helpful and if they didn't have immediate answers, they found someone who did.
I would also say it was a good value.
review.positiveRemarks: We chose this hotel because it was close to the airport. We were arriving late and, after a seven hour flight, we just wanted to hit the sack.
review.locationRemarks: It was conveniently close to the airport and the Bart station. The location allowed us to get on the BART in the morning and head into the city.

review.title: Very convenient to the airport
review.reviewText:
On the plus side this hotel boasts a great workout room...water bottles at each station and even cold towels to help cool down after workout.
On the minus side,we had to wait at least 25 minutes for the shuttle bus to get us at the airport and transport us to the hotel.  The ride back to the airport was much more efficient.
review.negativeRemarks: Better shuttle bus service

review.reviewText: Great place stay and walking distance to the Bart. Helpful staff.
review.negativeRemarks: It would be nice if the bathroom toilet and shower tub are newer.

review.reviewText: Nice hotel but located within a couple of blocks of unsafe area so you have to be careful to make sure you don't travel in that direction.
review.locationRemarks: Location is near unsafe area so you have to be careful.  But assuming you head in the other direction, it is convenient to Union Square et. al.

review.title: Good for a one night stay
review.reviewText: Excellent service! Friendly and helpful staff! Lovely breakfast!

review.title: Cheapest hotel in the area
review.reviewText: Overall good. With the exception of a delay in having my luggage delivered to the room, everything was fine.
review.positiveRemarks: price, convenience and it's Heavenly Beds!
review.negativeRemarks: Service...baggage was not delivered to the room in a timely manner, even though the hotel wasn't busy at that time of day.

photos.caption: Relaxing pool after a long day of sightseeing

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: This place was very nice and loved the indoor pool. Unfortunately the front desk staff wasn't the most welcoming. One male employee in particular was borderline rude when we checked in. Throughout our stay only the housekeeping pstaff would greet us with a smile as we passed them by in the hotel. But overall the place was comfortable, nice and reasonably priced.

review.title: Amazing
review.reviewText: Loved it. Great staff. Prefect room. Loved the shower.

review.title: Great hotel by the airport
review.reviewText: Everyone was so friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay again.

review.title: Great location for access to SFO Airport
review.reviewText: Good place to stay if you can book a bay view room at around $100-$150/night. Not so good if you have to pay more.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to SFO with shuttle and public transportation BART/CALTRAIN; room service uses same menu as restaurant; hotel staff nice, helpful and friendly

review.title: Very beautiful, modern hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was very clean and modern. The beds were extremely comfortable. Plus there is free shuttle from the airport. Highly recommended.

it was good

review.title: Close to airport and real nice.
review.reviewText: Real nice hotel. Great restaurant bar and restaurant. Staff very courteous.

review.title: Nice hotel, close to airport. Great staff!
review.reviewText: Wonderful trip to west coast! A good hotel for last night of our visit. Hotel bar has a great bartender, terrific food and relaxing atmosphere!

Leaving SFO after a vacation.
Stayed here for proximity to airport.
Nice hotel!
Shuttle service was packed!!!
review.positiveRemarks: Location was perfect for our needs.
review.negativeRemarks:

review.title: Convenient to airport
review.reviewText: ...I don't want to write anything in this section. I said everything I want to say.

review.title: Staff is amazing. Very accommodating to theiguest.
review.reviewText: Had a wonderful stays. Hotel is very relaxing and the staff are extremely nice

review.title: Very good hotel, close to SFO airport
review.reviewText:
Me along with my wife travelled to SFO from Austin, Texas for May long weekend on 2014 . After being so tired with flight journey and car rental pick-up, this place which is so close to SFO Int'l airport, was really heartening thing.
Only downside of this hotel is, they charge you with 25$ of parking fee, which they already mentioned in the description, other than that, no complaints what-so-ever
Very close to restaurants
review.negativeRemarks: Remove $25 extra fee for car parking

review.title: Airport Westin
review.reviewText: Overall very nice. NO PARKING spaces left after 10 pm though and you pay extra to park.
review.positiveRemarks: Right across the street from the Rail/BART terminal.
review.negativeRemarks: MORE PARKING

review.title: Nice place
review.reviewText: Did not like the fact that I booked with expedia, 3 weeks prior and booked 2 beds for 3 people and paid extra for 3rd person and once arrived had 1 king size bed only available, they gave us a cot also, but I had booked 2 beds, not happy. They gave us free breakfast but starts at 6:30 only and we had to leave for airport then, not happy at all.

review.title: Parking was a major issue
review.reviewText:
After paying for the parking ($20) a day, we drove around the lot for 45 minutes looking for a spot. Apparently a wedding reception was being hosted by the hotel and the wedding guest got priority parking while the guest of the hotel had to park off site, lug the baggage across the street to get inside the hotel.

This group of wedding guests were parked in the disable spots without proper authorization and no one policing the violations. I am disable and could not park because of this problem. Also it was very inconvenient to manuver around the lot because cars were double parked and were parked in the fire lanes. Again no policing!!
review.positiveRemarks: The rooms were clean and bed was comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel management need to be attentive to the parking situation. Take responsibility and give priority to the paying guests!
review.locationRemarks: Close to SFO airport.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Very close to airport but rooms have very thin walls.

review.title: Easily accessible and convenient
review.reviewText: Easy to get to, the driver of the shuttle was superb willing to take any bag on no matter how heavy. Check in smooth and the room all it had to be!

review.title: A true haven for the weary traveler
review.reviewText: Flights were being cancelled all over the board at DFW airport due to thunderstorms. When we limped out of the airport we were tired, frustrated and cranky. The uniformly friendly and helpful staff had us feeling better from the moment we stepped onto the shuttle bus and were offered bottles of chilled water. Everyone in the hotel, bar-staff, waiters, receptionists, know their jobs and do them well. Elegant common areas, and a beautiful, enormous room with a view of planes taking off and landing, have us looking forward to our next delay in Dallas.
review.negativeRemarks: Only the bar menu was available in the grill due to hi volume expectations. How is a DFW hotel not used to that?

review.title: The Westin certainly is nice enough.
review.reviewText: I prefer to be able to open windows. TV channel listings in the hotel service directory were mostly wrong. Limited food items being both the same in the restaurant as for room service (which is exceedingly expensive). The Cobb salad was good though. The drinks were very good. The room clean and very comfortable. And the airport shuttle is very good. The Westin worked well for my needs. Thanks.
review.positiveRemarks: The gin and tonic was excellent!
review.negativeRemarks: I think some out door seating / patio off the restaurant would be very nice esp being in CA.
review.locationRemarks: As far as I could tell there was nothing nearby so I was stuck for the balance of the day in order to get my 7:00 a.m. flight.

review.title: Close to Airport and convenient to move around. Go
review.reviewText: Not too bad. The Westin Hotel is a 5-star brand, however, room facilities were not adequate to be rated as excellent due to lack of basic toileties e.g. cotton bud and etc, slipper only upon request.

review.title: Few gotchas
review.reviewText: Westin is my favorite chain and sorry to say that this is worst Westin hotel I have stayed and I have stayed in many of them. Although it wasn't too bad of a hotel but there were few things that makes me say that. The gallery had smoke smell. The room didn't have even mini fridge. Rest everything was okay! I would stay there again if I get it really cheap. Otherwise I would prefer somewhere else like four square.

review.title: Disorganized and understaffed
review.reviewText:
Took 2 hours to get luggage from front desk and then first try was the wrong luggage. Took telephone operator about 10 rings each time to pick up and then never returned with an answer as she had told us she would.

Waiter, Jonathan was excellent in the bar restaurant and food was fine.
review.negativeRemarks: Service I just told you about
review.locationRemarks: walk along the water and look at planes taking off and landing

review.title: Well run hotel by SFO
review.reviewText: For an airport hotel, the Westin is about as good as you can expect. Nice sized, clean room, great bed, fast elevators, decent to very good common area, and, in my case, a nice view out to the airport runway and SF bay. Also quiet, except for the occasional rumble of planes landing.

review.title: It was ok.
review.reviewText: It was ok, pretty nice. Indoor pool & hot tub. Pool had bleach in it. It turned my friends black shirt brown, took the color out of my sisters hair, and totally irritated all of our eyes. There was no complementary wifi, no complementary coffee, no complementary anything really.
review.positiveRemarks: The indoor pool. Minus the bleach. Staff was friendly.

review.title: GOOD HOTEL FOR AIRPORT STAY OR WEEKEND IN SF
review.reviewText: Jacuzzi was hot and hotel restaurant was not bad at all. I was pleasantly surprised.

review.title: Near airport, along bay shore
review.reviewText: Close to airport, with great shore trail starting in front of hotel (running). Decent on-site restaurant option. Extra parking (twenty) and internet (fifteen) over-priced and extra-skimming.
review.negativeRemarks: Cost of basic extras: parking, internet
review.locationRemarks: Direct shore trail access (running). Close to airport

review.title: Very convenient location, so close to SF Airport!
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel, very friendly and helpful staff! The room was very clean and comfortable! The bed was wonderful and gave me the first good night's sleep since being on my trip. A great place to stay!
review.locationRemarks: I was only there overnight, to catch a flight out of SF Airport. Very convenient to the airport.

review.title: Brief but outstanding experience
review.reviewText: We were there less than 12 hours, but couldn't have had a better experience. Everyone was friendly and helpful. The room was squeaky clean and the beds were so comfortable. We were exhausted after a long day and were so relieved to have such a wonderful place to stay. The restaurant was also an outstanding experience: the wait staff was charming and warm and helpful, and the food was delicious. Particularly, I appreciated that there were plenty of vegetarian options. I would definitely stay there again, given the opportunity. Thank you!
review.locationRemarks: This hotel is extremely close to the airport, which meant a lot to us as we had to make a 6am flight the next morning.

review.title: Extremely Disappointing
review.reviewText:
I am not a negative person or particular traveller. I have never written a review about a hotel previously.
However, in this case, the very well established Westin brand and reputation are utterly inconsistent with the condition of this property.
This hotel is in quite poor and shabby condition.

review.title: Good location near airport.
review.reviewText: Good location for our needs. Room was in need of renovation (and I think it started right after we left).

review.title: Just appreciated the excellent staff.
review.reviewText: It was me and my husbands 3rd Anniversary. Carmen I believe was her name, comped us a bottle of Champagne. So sweet and warm, my husband had to give her a hug. She was awesome with our check in
review.negativeRemarks: The decorating of the hall walls

review.title: quality hotel close to airport
review.reviewText: good food and bar at reasonable prices. helpful staff.
review.positiveRemarks: comfortable convenient to transit and airport. suitable for late nite arrival or early airport departure
review.negativeRemarks: renovate bathroom

review.title: Great stay!
review.reviewText: picked this hotel primarily for the location since we didn't drive - close to the millbrae caltrain/bart station. very pleased with the super efficient check in & check out; the complimentary bottles of water & coffee/tea were much appreciated! would definitely stay here again!
review.positiveRemarks: location & complimentary bottled waters! there's a plaza with a panera bread, in & out burger, etc on the way from bart to the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: we couldn't figure out how to turn tv on if it was working. didn't need it, but it's probably a good thing to check every so often.
review.locationRemarks: within walking distance to the millbrae bart/caltrain station-so, it is super easy to get around without a car. we went to berkeley, sf & sfo by bart.

review.title: Great Airport Hotel
review.reviewText: The Westin San Francisco Airport is located about as close as you can get to the airport, and wit shuttles every 15 minutes 24 hours a day, it's a stress-free place to stay for travellers. The rooms are spacious and well-appointed and everything was spotless and clean in my room. The mattress was large and comfortable with plenty of pillows. If you need exercise, the fitness center is great, and there's also a nice running/jogging trail along the bay shore that's easiliy qccessible from the hotel. All in all, this is the kind of place I would recommend to friends and definitely stay at again.
review.positiveRemarks: Big, well appointed, and clean rooms.

review.title: airport flight delay
review.reviewText: I had to spend the night in San Francisco due to weather, so I booked at the Westin. The hotel is very close to the airport, has dependable shuttle service to and fro, and helpful staff. This is a well used hotel and could benefit from some upgrading, but I found it to be clean and comfortable and a welcome respite after a disappointing day of travel.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked that it was so close to the airport and a brand name hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Some minor upgrading (bathroom fixtures, etc.) is about all that needs to be done here. Maybe it would be fun to brighten the hallways, too.
review.locationRemarks: I have no clue what there is to do nearby since I did nothing but sleep, but the location was perfect. It's close to the airport and quiet.

review.title: Almost perfect
review.reviewText:
Because of the low rates and generally nice hotel all around I am giving it 4/5. If I had to pay more it might be 3/5.

The airport runways are real close so you hear them fairly well. I was on the side facing the runways so maybe a non-bay view room would be quieter. Bay view costs more because the view is real nice but I am guessing its much noisier than opposite side.

The concierge was kind but not very helpful. Gave our cab driver the wrong street name which ended up costing us an extra $30 for a less than $20 dinner that was maybe a mile away.

They didn't plan out the parking lot very well either. It fills up so much at night that a good number of people do not have a spot to park.

That being said, other than the parking, all can be avoided if I stay there again. Which, if the rates are that much lower than the rest of the hotels close to SFO I would likely do so.

The bar & grill at the hotel was a good place to eat and have a few drinks watching some 2014 Olympics & basketball. Live music and all the people on Friday and Saturday night gave it a different atmosphere than one would expect at an airport/business hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to SFO, clean, great rates.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking lot.
review.locationRemarks: Its very close to SFO, downtown Millbrae is nearby with lots of markets, restaurants and such.

review.title: Family stay
review.reviewText: We celebrated my grandson's birthday party at the hotel with some of his classmates. The kids were ecstatic that they can go swimming.
review.positiveRemarks: Accessible to the freeway and friendly staff.

review.title: Great beds
review.reviewText: Great beds, everything was excellent, the location chosen as I needed to be close to the airport

review.title: Run down hotel
review.reviewText:
Show handle is broken
No fridge in the room
High wi- fi fee for everyday

review.title: Travolociyy @westin s.f.airp ok rt
review.reviewText: Booked room thru expidia.each time were put in handicap toom.

review.title: close to beach
review.reviewText: nice stay; clean rooms; bathroom bit outdated; comfortable bed; near airport but still quiet; very convenient to airport

review.title: SFO hotel--a wonderful buy!
review.reviewText: I loved the relaxed feeling of the hotel. The bed was super. And, it was very quiet!
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Well--it is really close to SFO and all of the attractions of the San Francisco Bay Area!

review.title: Nice hotel close to SFO
review.reviewText: Clean and convenient hotel to stay. Most dislike thing is you have to pay 20 dollars parking for every night.

review.title: Renovated nice place near airport but they charge
review.reviewText: I've just about had it with hotels that charge for internet. Yes, the lobby is all modern and W'd out and the bed is comfy. But that counts for little in this digital age. They might as well charge for water and toilet paper.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Very nice staffs, and nice ambience very close to the airport. I stayed their with my family for 4 days, without much hustle. Good restaurant near the lobby. But you have to pay 20 bucks per day for car parking. But you have to pay 20 bucks per day for car parking.

review.title: OK hotel
review.reviewText: Was expecting a great hotel experience with it being the "Westin" but it was just OK. Loved that the pool was indoor and my daughter was able to enjoy swimming in 55 degree weather. Could have done without the $20/day parking. Not worth it.

review.title: Close to airport with free shuttle
review.reviewText: Stayed for an early morning flight the next day to bypass morning traffic to the airport. I had myself, my 2 young boys, their car seats and all our luggage. I asked for help when we checked in as was told "no problem" but I couldn't find anyone so I started loading everything onto a cart myself. While I was loading, a bellman appeared but he didn't come to my aid! He knew I was there because he held the door open as I wrestled the luggage cart through. I schlepped everything myself through the lobby, in the elevator and up to the room with people staring at us the whole time. Bellman aside, the stay was great. The restaurant food was better than expected and the wait staff was very accommodating to my boys (a huge plus!) The pool looked nice, the rooms were comfy and clean, and we made it to the airport with ease. Be aware- the shuttle trip takes longer than the staff quotes because it makes a few stops so I suggest taking it earlier than needed!

review.title: Nice, clean and safe place to stay.
review.reviewText:
Stayed 3 nights, very nice hotel, staff helpful and close to tranportation. A main BART staton Is about a 10 minute walk away or a $6 cab ride. $4 train ride to down town. Felt safe walking to the station even late at night. Only thing was room service was costly. I think about $15 for cold cereal with tip and fee. We just order out and things were fine.
All in all a good place to stay.

review.title: Won't stay again.
review.reviewText: Why anyone would choose the Westin over the other great options at SF Airport is beyond me.
