The Embassy Suites, the Hilton Garden Inns, offer nicer accomodations and much better value. Westin charges $20 for parking. The others do not charge parking. I am an SPG member, but Westin would not credit my stay since I made the reservation through Expedia. Will never stay here again. Rooms outdated and depressing.
review.negativeRemarks: everything

review.title: Modern clean
review.reviewText: Excellent would return

review.title: Great Nights Sleep
review.reviewText: This hotel was fantastic. The bayside room with 2 -beds was a little smaller but nice and quiet. Thw hotel staff was great!
Our tv didn't work. The paint on the walls was scraped up. There was no list of what was available in the room, and how to access it ... For instance, the WiFi.
review.negativeRemarks: A booklet on how to access what was being offered.

review.title: Pretty quiet for an Airport Hotel
review.reviewText: From beginning to end: The parking fee was average since the place also served as a shuttle spot. The entry was welcoming. The have a top coffee cafe as well as a restaurant with some healthy choices. A couple elevators (with a third not working) lead you to as many as 7 floors. Maybe it's because our view faced the east( opposite SFO) but we had a quiet room. The plumbing quality was fair, as the bathtub backed up, and the toilet flushed slowly. The hot water was immediately dispensed, though, from the faucet and tub. Again, amenities touted top coffee and tea choices, but sugar and cream was so limited that we had to call for more just to satisfy the first coffee. The staff was quite friendly and fairly prompt.

review.title: Close to airport
review.reviewText: Nice place to stay it. It's close to the airport and offers a shuttle to the airport. If you're into working out, the hotel offers New Balance workout clothes and shoes for $5 during your stay so you pack light. The rooms were clean as well. I am definitely staying here again and would recommend it.

review.title: Staff was very helpful.
review.reviewText: Close to the airport for an early morning flight.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the airport

review.title: Close to Candlestick
review.reviewText: Staff was friendly upon check-in, but it was downhill afterwards. Air conditioner was off in the room, which was stuffy. We turned the thermostat to sixty-six degrees and only cooled down minimally throughout the night. There was a fridge, but it was unplugged and locked with no sign of a key. Then the tub wouldn't drain while taking a shower. Luckily we were only there one night and left early for the football game.
review.negativeRemarks: Air conditioning and refrigerator.
review.locationRemarks: Airport and Candlestick Park.

review.title: Hotel needs updating
review.reviewText: Our stay was good, comfortable, the linens were exceptional and for being so close to the airport, very quiet. However for being such a well known hotel chain the facilitity is in need of updating especially the hall & bathroom lighting, also the bathrooms could use fans it was extremely hot in the bathroom
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was very courteous and the hotel was quiet
review.negativeRemarks: cleanliness and updating of fixtures

review.title: Great way to end a trip
review.reviewText: We had spent 10 days in California and had done a LOT of driving. We wanted a hassle free morning the day of our flight home so we decided a hotel by the airport would be perfect. What a delight. Everyone was so helpful. We printed our boarding passes, had a drink in the bar, checked out our beautiful room and later had a casual dinner in the Grill. The room was nicely appointed---loved the extra mirror in the bathroom for makeup!!! The bed was comfy, a great shower and easy access to return our rental car in the morning. If we fly into San Francisco again we will be back!!!!
review.locationRemarks: We picked it for close proximity to the airport.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Awesome hotel near the airport and the beach. But the shuttle is too late, we waited around 45mins in the mid-night at the shuttle area of the airport for the first shuttle's arriving.
review.negativeRemarks: Shuttle bus should be there on time

review.title: Nice hotel- but charged for Internet!
review.reviewText:
Arriving from a long flight from London we decided to stay close to the airport on arrival. The Westin was cheapest out of the lot, and only 5 mins drive from the airport. We thought that the rooms were nice, clean and comfy, the restaurant was a bit dark (no windows) but the food was good and reasonably priced (although breakfast was expensive $22). The only thing that was annoying was that there was a charge for the Internet in your room and if you wanted to print things out you had to pay to use the business centre. We also thought (as an airport hotel) it was a bit cheeky to charge for car parking $20.
Overall good- but should definitely give free Internet access for guests as part of the price of your room.
review.negativeRemarks: Free Internet please!

review.title: loud hotel
review.reviewText: very loud due to planes taking off and landing. The hotel really did not offer much. Had to pay for everything. Internet, parking, even lobby internet. Parking was 20.00 a day. internet 4.95 for 4 Hours. Staff was great.
review.positiveRemarks: nice room. nice pool for the kiddies
review.locationRemarks: lots of things to do near bay. Nice walking path in back of hotel. buss and bart within walking distance.

review.title: Disappointed since previous visit
review.reviewText:
I stayed here several years ago and had an excellent experience at a very low price. I must have stayed in an upgraded room, because this time the room was just standard. Toilet plugged up and we had to call housekeeping, shower didn't drain well.

Expect extra charges: $20 for parking, $5 for data connection, $11 for continental breakfast. The rate that looked so reasonable isn't any more after you add $36 to it.

Only good thing: bed is very comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Don't tack on charges for parking, data, continental breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Right by the airport, so no sights nearby. Downtown is 30 minutes away.

review.negativeRemarks: Having to pay for parking was a real disappointment! Faucet in bathtub had a leak and while showering tub would fill up with water!

review.title: SAN FRANCISCO WESTIN STAY
review.reviewText: THE HOTEL WAS NICE BUT CHARGED FOR EVERY LITLLE THING. EVEN THE REFRIGERATOR WAS LOCKED AND YOU HAD TO PAY TO STORE FOOD OR DRINKS. IT WAS A NICE HOTEL BUT EVERYTHING ADDS UP.
review.negativeRemarks: NOT CHARGE FOR PARKING, REFRIGERATOR, INTERNET ACCESS, ETC..
review.locationRemarks: THE DISTANCE FROM SF WAS A LITTLE FARTHER THAN EXPECTED.

review.title: Not expensive, pretty clean, closest to Airport
review.reviewText: Pretty good, worth the price, friendly personal, good bar and grill. Pets friendly.

review.title: Quick stay, very nice
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice and extremely close to the airport. You do have to pay for parking, and they don't have a shuttle to Candlestick park. I was only there for one day, and my room wasn't ready when we arrived, but other than those couple of things, everything was nice.

review.title: Great location to the airport.
review.reviewText: The Hotel is great. Its right by the airport so you can hear planes coming and going but it wasnt to bad.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel is very clean and quite.

review.title: Centrally located in San Francisco.
review.reviewText: Quiet and pleasant. Room condition and furnishing adequate but not on par with price. I had expected better based on website photos.
review.negativeRemarks: Either improve appearance of rooms or lower price.
review.locationRemarks: Located four blocks from Union Square and Cable Cars. Took 20 minutes to walk to Moscone Conference Center.

review.title: Decent for the price.
review.reviewText: I only stayed 2 nights. Hotel had free water bottles which was nice. Price for parking wasn't obscene. Rooms were comfortable and clean. The only reason I give it 4 stars instead of 5 was proximity to the air port...you could hear the plans taking off and landing. Walls were paper thin...you could hear people on either side of you easily. I like the idea that they encouraged fitness with the New Balance initiative where they'd lend you sneakers.
review.positiveRemarks: Checked us in early and staff was helpful with transportation.
review.negativeRemarks: Shield sound better.
review.locationRemarks: Take the BARC train close by to get in and out of San Francisco easily and affordably. Airport was close.

review.title: Great hotel and staff!!
review.reviewText: Very accommodating and great customer service! Staff was really helpful.

review.title: Can't believe it has a 5 star rating!
review.reviewText: Shocked by the mismatched furniture, ikea lamps and banged-up walls. Just not what I was expecting at all.
review.positiveRemarks: The person that checked me in was super nice and helpful. I liked that it had an airport shuttle.
review.negativeRemarks: It could use a soft goods upgrade and as a minimum matching furniture (chairs to ottomans that sort of thing).
review.locationRemarks: The location was perfect for the airport.

review.title: Airport hotel - makes delayed flight bearable
review.reviewText: Great, older, but well-maintained airport hotel. When my friend's international flight arrival was delayed past midnight, the Westin was a great option for us and much better than making the trek back to Sacramento. Plus, we got to spend the next day in the City and East Bay seeing friends.

review.title: Ok hotel, terrible neighborhood
review.reviewText: After a quick 2-day business trip, here's my conclusion. The hotel itself is mediocre at absolute best: the rooms were clean and the bathroom functional (until my blow dryer broke). The neighborhood is super sketchy - next door is a large casino and the rest of the surrounding streets are taken up by half-abandoned strip mall-type places and bail bonds offices. I would never, in a million years, take my family there. Oh, and BTW, the air conditioning system broke so it was about 80 degrees in my room overnight.

review.title: Close to airport
review.reviewText: Convenient to Bart made it easy to get around. Particularly to go into the city.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to airport and Bart Free airport shuttle

review.title: Great Stay
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was fantastic and the hotel was perfect!

review.title: Airport adjacent for next early morning flight
review.reviewText: Found a weird little bug climbing up the chair in initial room. I just took it down to the desk to show them--it was alive and I thought they might want to i.d. it. I don't know what it was, but they immediately moved me up to a room with a better view and offered to by me a glass of wine and an appetizer in the restaurant by the lobby.
review.positiveRemarks: The walking path across the street and the free airport shuttle. The shower was nice and the bed was comfy.
review.negativeRemarks: It needs some TLC, paint and polish and updating.
review.locationRemarks: Didn't see anything to do nearby, but I was just there so I could get to the airport early. It had a bar/restaurant on premises.

review.title: Westin Bayshore
review.reviewText: Very nice staff, from the guys out front to the front desk and other support staff.
review.positiveRemarks: Room as nice, but the people made the real difference.
review.negativeRemarks: Can't think of anything major.
review.locationRemarks: N/A.

review.title: Nice hotel close to the airport.
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was great, they took care of all our needs. We had 5 rooms between me and my family. Only complaint was non of the rooms had a fridge. Some had safes and did not.
review.negativeRemarks: Can't understand why the rooms don't have fridges.

review.title: Enjoyable
review.reviewText: Convenient to SFO, reasonably priced and very comfortable accommodations

review.title: Airport Hotel great spot
review.reviewText: Hotel was close to San Fran airport, that is why I booked. Staff were great, food was good and location was perfect. 5 minutes from San Fran airport and 5 minute walk to BART station to downtown San Fran. Had a great time, felt safe and room was very comfortable. After a week hiking in Yosemite and sleeping in a tent cabin, room was a real treat!
review.positiveRemarks: Staff were great, food was good and location was perfect. 5 minutes from San Fran airport and 5 minute walk to BART station to downtown San Fran.
review.negativeRemarks: Pricing, charged extra for overnight parking and internet access.
review.locationRemarks: Location was perfect. 5 minutes from San Fran airport and 5 minute walk to BART station to downtown San Fran.

review.title: Good for night before an early flight.
review.reviewText: Great hotel for the night before an early flight, plenty of room for a family and a great pool and restaurant. Staff a little perfunctory.

review.title: a traveler
review.reviewText: hotel is clean and comfort. staffs are friendly. but the internet service fee is too high.
review.negativeRemarks: if possible increase the frequency of the airport shuttle service.

review.title: Convenient location near the airport
review.reviewText: Hotel is very nice, and similar to other Westins. My room was very quiet and everything worked. It was a room that I could work or relax in - large with comfortable furnishings. Everything was clean and well maintained.
review.positiveRemarks: Location with shuttle service to & from the airport, clean and safe.
review.negativeRemarks: TV was annoying - very limited stations, and half of the stations did not seem to work in my room.
review.locationRemarks: I'm not sure that I would stay here if my goal was "doing San Francisco," but great to stay before you fly out, and also good for exploring south bay

review.title: Crappy airport hotel
review.reviewText: Beds were not comfortable, I booked two queens but was given two doubles. They charge extra for wifi which is a big cash grab. Will not stay here again
review.negativeRemarks: The wifi charge

review.title: Great room; fabulously convenient location.
review.reviewText:
Overall good, not great; inadequate dining/drinking fcilities with nothing in the neighborhood to take up the slack. Advertised restaurant 'Ariba' not evident if it was hidden somewhere. Weekend overwhelmed by wedding receptions which sucked up all the front-of-house staff attention. Comp airport shuttle runs substantially less frequently than Marriott and Hyatt competitors shuttles (I had way to much time to count shuttles at the airport pickup stop as I used the shuttle to get to the BART station in the airport). I had a two-night stay, I returned late for my second night to find an uncleaned room; I put the plackard on the door handle with the "Rest Easy" side turned inward; guess the housekeeping staff took this for "don't clean the room". Every other hotel I have ever stayed at has a two-sided card to avoid this confusion.
Enough of the complaints; front desk, concierge, housekeepers,shuttle bus driver, lobby convenience store personned were all friendly, usually helpful, and usually available. Again, the weddings appeared to overwhelm the hotel. Everything was spotless; bed was the best therapy my cervical vertebrae have had in years; air temperature perfect. Like the location across the street from the bayside park. Somehow all airport noises were insulated out so the airport might as well have been miles away. Few airport hotels can say that. Of course the convenience to the airport is probably the biggest plus. A solid B+ grade.
review.negativeRemarks: above; need a cafe.
review.locationRemarks: Bayfront park is a big plus; neighborhood seems to be a wasteland.

review.title: Overnight stay before long haul flight
review.reviewText:
Ideal situation for the airport, Well maintained and staffed facility, food/drink wee bit expensive (only in my opinion obviously)
Good frontage area for a bit of modest walking along the bay area.
We would use this hotel again !
review.negativeRemarks: The explaining of the form at breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Whole bay area to visit

review.title: Easy access to airport
review.reviewText: Some reviews note that this hotel is a bit older, but it does not detract from its purpose and role. Beds are typically Westin (very comfortable) and room was clean and inviting even if a standard motel room in virtually all aspects--but that is exactly what you expect when you book a room of this type. Staff was friendly and efficient. No complaints.
review.negativeRemarks: A bit of updating would be helpful but does not detract from its value

review.title: Good airport location
review.reviewText: Was very comfortable after a long cross country flight.

review.title: Very nice hotel near the airport.
review.reviewText: Easy to get in and out. Very clean and pleasant accomodations. A little understaffed in the valet/bellman stands out front.

review.title: Great for traveling with a small dog
review.reviewText: This was the best experience I have had at a hotel. I traveled with my dog and arrived to a room with a map of dog parks, a water bowl, and even help assembling my airplane dog crate. The staff were remarkable.
review.locationRemarks: All of san fransisco

review.title: Pricey adequacy
review.reviewText: Charging extra for internet after already inflated room rates is absurd. The hotel feels old and worn, but the rooms show less age. Great for access to the airport with free shuttle, but that's about it for amenities. The pool is much less impressive in person, but what else could you expect from deceptive photos. Within walking distance of a few fast food joints and the Caltrain.

review.title: Relaxing hotel close to SFO.
review.reviewText: After a wedding stayed at the Westin before flying out the next morning. Easy check in. Comfortable rooms and beds. Great breakfast in the morning tho a tad pricey. Yes, would return. A great value for the $
review.negativeRemarks: There should be a less expensive alternative on the breakfast menu. One croissant, coffee and a glass of Orange juice was $18 !!!

review.title: Great hotel close to airport
review.reviewText: Just an excellent stay with great service close to sfo
review.negativeRemarks: All good
review.locationRemarks: Just relaxed at hotel

review.title: Hotel close to SFO w/ all the amenities.
review.reviewText: The hotel itself is conveniently located close to San Francisco Airport. Facility is very nice. Love the indoor pool specially if you have kids. Staff very pleasant & always ready to help.

review.title: Convenient to airport
review.reviewText: Stayed overnight in order to board a cruise ship. The hotel was lovely, clean, bed comfortable, staff friendly and helpful
review.positiveRemarks: The ease of check in. The friendliness of the staff, the cleanliness
review.locationRemarks: Stayed to be close to the airport and cruise ship

review.title: Excellent stay!
review.reviewText: After spending a week traveling up the north coast and staying in several uncomfortable and uninspired rooms I was desperate for a comfortable bed. I found that and so much more at the Westin at San Fransico Airport! The beds were a dream come true soft sheets and bedding The mattress was heaven sent! Even though it was close to airport noise was not a problem.The staff was very helpfull and respectfull. The only down side was paying 20 dollars a night to park.
review.negativeRemarks: pool water was too cold and the price of parking.

review.title: Stayed only because it was pet friendly
review.reviewText:
Checked in tired and cranky from our long drive. Person who checked us in wasn't very patient and nice although he knows his spiel pretty well. You can tell that he was annoyed of our crankiness --- dude, it's not personal and it will definitely help if you smile. (definitely needs 101 in customer service).

I love housekeeping, it's as if they were on the floor all the time and very prompt too. Made small talk and re assures us that if there is anything that we need to just either tell her or call. We had no problem sleeping in their bed because it was so comfortable. The room was clean and plenty of room with 2 adults plus a small dog.

Not much options with food though, we actually thought of just ordering delivery because of the choices for room service. All they had was a lounge which looked nice but we didn't try it.

Cheking out is easy breezy, love the updates in the room (TV and shower heads). You have to pay for parking even if you're staying in the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Bed, pillows (very comfy) and room cleanliness. I love how they accomodated pets, did not charge extra per stay and provided for dog ammenities.
review.negativeRemarks: Food! Options of where to eat is very limited to one lounge. Parking fee is a pain considering we were not in the downtown area.
review.locationRemarks: Nothing much to do or to go to in the area except for the long bayside walk which was really nice. Marriot did a good job utilizing that area.

review.title: Expensive for what they offer
review.reviewText: Extremely high price for an outdated hotel. Needs renovation. Bed sheets are not changed after the previous guests have left. Expensive parking, wifi in rooms is paid. Long line at front desk to check in.

review.title: Nice hotel great view
review.reviewText: The staff were very friendly. Nice room very quiet . Nice area will definetly stay again my next trip

review.title: Fantastic
review.reviewText: I'd never stayed at a nice hotel before. The bed, sheets, towels, robe are super soft and comfy. The staff is great, food is good. Even the parking meter is nice to you (it wishes you a great stay when you come back in and tells you to have fun and drive safe if you're on your way out). I couldn't be happier.

review.title: perfect for early next morning flight
review.reviewText:
if you have an early flight, and have spent a few days in SFO/ Napa/ etc.. you may want to consider staying here for your last night.

1. free shuttle to the airport (goes by hotel every 10-20 mins)
2. great rates (compared to staying in San Francisco) I saved $250 in hotel stay for that last night.

you can maximize your san francisco's last day by leaving your bags at your previous hotel bell desk.. go out tourist around, and then when you are ready to "go to sleep" you go and stay here, you will save money..

Safe Travels..

review.title: westin luxery
review.reviewText: great luxerious hotel, lived up to and beyond reputation. wish you didn't have to pay for wi-fi in room or parking but.... very convenient location and gorgeous pool area!

review.title: Quick Stop
review.reviewText: I stayed at the Westin San Francisco Airport prior to an early morning flight. Everything was wonderful! The room was very comfortable, morning coffee was provided, the staff was helpful but not obtrusive. I spent a very restful night after a hectic week of visiting relatives, took the shuttle to the airport early the next AM. No problems encountered anywhere. Would have loved to stay longer! Will be a preferred stop the next time I am in San Francisco!
review.positiveRemarks: Beautiful room, all the amenities I needed (including a lovely, comfortable robe) - quiet, which I also needed! And accessible to the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing.
review.locationRemarks: Can;t answer this, except for the airport, which was the reason I was there. I was not there long enough to explore the location.

review.title: Excellent, convenient, great price and food!
review.reviewText: I always stay at The Westin when I'm traveling via SFO. It's convenient, really nice, quiet, great linens, nice products, amazing food, and good service. The shuttle is fab too!

review.title: Excellent hotel near airport.
review.reviewText: This is a modern clean hotel very close and convenient to the San Francisco Airport.

review.title: Great spot for a lay.over in SF
review.reviewText: Excellent accommodation and facilities. The staff are courteous and helpful. Convenient and reliable shuttle service to the airport. BART located nearby making for easy access to downtown attractions.o

review.title: Convenient but meh
review.reviewText:
Good place to stay if you have an early morning flight out of SFO.
Pros:
Clean room & decent facilities
5 min drive to SFO

Cons:
Parking is NOT free - they charge you $20 for overnight parking
wifi is not free and is slow
review.negativeRemarks: see cons above

review.title: great hotel overall
review.reviewText: Great hotel overall. Just didn't get little things replace (shampoo ect.. )
review.locationRemarks: Very easy to find

review.title: Trip to San Francisco
review.reviewText: People at the front desk were very helpful and excellent to deal with. Room was very clean and nice. Great all around. Easy on/off access to the highways. Even though right by the airport was very quiet.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel was great, the staff was courteous and couldn't be closer to the hotel. The only criticism I have is the hallways were a bit worn and could use some freshening up. Otherwise it was great!

review.title: Recent Business Stay
review.reviewText: The hotel is nice the staff friendly and accomodating. The hotel is convienently located to the airport and shuttle service is provided, however, there are not any resturants within walking distance, so unless you take a taxi, or have your own transportation you are limited to the one on-site cafe.

review.title: Great hotel near the airport
review.reviewText: Very nice looking hotel close to the airport. Bed was very comfortable and room was very modern. Provide an airport shuttle that leaves every 15 mins.
review.negativeRemarks: no wifi in room
review.locationRemarks: very close to airport

review.title: Just ok
review.reviewText:
Great service but room are tired and need updating. Bath drain was plugged, marks on walks
and the gym was horrible. Cage was great and an ok breakfast.

review.title: Not worth the money!!
review.reviewText: What hotel is 160 with NO refrigerator and a 1980 cordless phone that doesn't work?? key word UPGRADE!!!!
review.negativeRemarks: needs upgrade, refrigerator in room
review.locationRemarks: says i had king size BAY room and i saw 2 inches of the so called bay...

review.title: A lot of add on charges!
review.reviewText:
Pay for internet - $5 fee for maid service - $20.00 to park car overnight - not enough room in parking lot - needed to park in neighboring hotel lot!

Breakfast buffet - very limited and very expensive!

Breakfast menu - no pancakes - waffles - etc...,

review.title: My Experience at the Westin
review.reviewText: I requested new wash cloths and nothing more from housekeeping in the morning before going to work and didn't get any. I made another request when I got back from work and before dinner. Finally when I got back to my room and didn't find any clean wash cloths I called the front desk again and asked very rudely for the 4th time. Let me not forget to mention no towels at the pool and asked to front desk and I got attitude.
review.negativeRemarks: Service
review.locationRemarks: Near everything

review.title: Nice people and a decent place to stop
review.reviewText:
IF you don't mind waiting 40 minutes for the shuttle to pick you up at night at SFO. I called as i entered baggage claim, called again after 25 minutes, called again after another 15 minutes before the van arrived. It was midnight but they said they had two working. Also, only one person at the desk at checkout at 8:30 Sunday AM.

But the van driver found and turned in a credit card that somehow slipped out of my pocket, so that saved me a lot of issues.

Nice folks, need better management/organization.

review.title: Do not stay at Westin Hotel in Millbrae, CA
review.reviewText: the worst hotel room and service I have ever experienced in any hotel.

review.title: Great location, needs a facelift really bad
review.reviewText: You would think a brand hotel like WESTIN would be on top of their hotels that are needing some interior work. This hotel, due to the location and popularity of it, should be high on their list for updates. My ceiling had a crack and the bathroom had one of those old bathroom smells. I will probably stay again but only because I need to catch an early flight out of SFO.
review.negativeRemarks: See my other comments
review.locationRemarks: Get on a plane and fly!

review.title: Good hotel for business travelers
review.reviewText: Convenient location....5 minutes from SFO Airport. The hotel restaurant has good food and drink. Room was clean except for bathroom sink. Staff are efficient and helpful. Large indoor pool attractively furnished. Great for business travelers.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness of the bathroom sink
review.locationRemarks: Convenient location just 5 minutes from SFO Airport.

review.title: Travling John
review.reviewText: If you want to stay by the San Francisco Airport, there is no better place to stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Charge for internet. We all must bond together and protest this.

review.title: "Good Hotel" "Too expensive for what it offers."
review.reviewText:
Front Desk Service was unacceptably bad and even a bit rude for a hotel of this rating. Room service and House Keeping staff excellent.
Service at restaurant for breakfast less than satisfactory.

Room is comfortable and clean but not exceptional as I expected it to be.
Lobby was unpleasant and tense.

Room service food for dinner and coffee was excellent.
Dining Room Food for breakfast was just OK.

Overall I was not displeased with my stay but for this amount of money I will probably not book this hotel again.

If it were cheaper-- yes.
review.positiveRemarks:
Quiet Room!
Big Bath Towels
Excellent Room Service
Nice View
review.negativeRemarks: Front Desk staff that made me want to leave before I even checked in. Restaurant Staff was slow and inattentive. (they were polite though).
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location

review.title: Comfotable hotel- lacks business amenities
review.reviewText: Great location. Very comfortable room. Wonderful air-conditioning. No outlets close to desk to use electronics- would need extension cord. Restaurant has good food but very limited menu. Would stay again and bring extension cord and outside food.
review.negativeRemarks: restaurant
review.locationRemarks: excellent

review.title: Love this Hotel
review.reviewText:
The location is very ideal to what we need. It is outside of the hustle and bustle of San Francisco but very accessible because it is walking distance to a major train station - Millbrae station. The airport is only a few minutes away. It is also accessible to a lot of restaurants.

We arrived early for check in but the concierge stored our bags. Justin in the front desk was so efficient and got us checked in immediately. It was just what we needed after a day touring San Francisco. Checking out was as effortless as checking in. The airport shuttle service ran every 15 minutes so did not wait that long.

The hotel is very quiet and comfortable. I will stay at Westin Millbrae again on my next visit to San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: none
review.locationRemarks: Very accessible by train, walking distance to the Millbrae Station.

review.title: Great commuter hotel
review.reviewText:
Very comfortable hotel. They were upgrading some of their lobby decor, but that did not detract from the hotel. Very convenient location to SFO. Located less than 5 miles from a large shopping center and about a mile from gas station, In & Out Burger and Panera Bread.
Easy access to major freeways and only 15 minutes from San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: Could hear some noise from next door rooms and housekeeping started at 8 am so put out the do not disturb sign.
review.locationRemarks: Close to airport and major freeways

review.title: Wait until the renovation is over!
review.reviewText: Location to SFO is great - but this hotel is undergoing a renovation and there is dust, scaffolding, painting, etc going on everywhere. Very disappointing for a Westin.
review.negativeRemarks: workmen and scaffolding in front lobby, restaurant was partially blocked due to renovations
review.locationRemarks: Within 1 mile of SFO

review.title: Great location to airport
review.reviewText: Very close to airport and staff were great. Would stay again for sure.

review.title: Very accommodating
review.reviewText: I chose this hotel for a place to sleep between flights from Australia to Canada for its proximity to the airport. They accommodated early check-in and early check-out and the free shuttle service to the airport was available before 5AM. It was quiet and very clean. I booked on Expedia and found the pricing very reasonable. I would definitely stay there again and recommend it to other travellers.

review.title: Always happy
review.reviewText: I am a frequent traveler and I am always impressed with the quality and service for the Westin properties

review.title: Over priced for what you get
review.reviewText: Very disappointed. Old and worn out looking needs updates. No restaurant under construction. Called us in the middle of the night to have us look in the bathroom to see if it was leaking. Probably would not stay there again.
review.locationRemarks: Right next to SFO

review.title: Busted Air Con - Again
review.reviewText: I stay at the Westin whenever I fly out of SFO. Thi is the second or the third time that the air conditioner has not worked. And I always figure out that it is not working after I'm unpacked, so its a pain to change rooms.

review.title: Park and fly
review.reviewText: The staff was attentive except for the day that we checked out. The desk clerk was rude and somewhat confrontational. However, I had paid Expedia for "park & fly" and had to pay for parking again. Was told by hotel that Expedia is not allowed or suppose to offer "park & fly" that only the hotel could do that. This need to be clarified.

review.title: Good airport hotel
review.reviewText: I would have given the hotel a 4 rating, but the bathroom was not clean. Mildewy grout in the shower, mildew on the ceiling and dead flies in the light fixture. Otherwise, the hotel was very quiet and comfortable.

review.title: Very nice hotel right next to SFO
review.reviewText: Really enjoyed my two-night stay. About as close to the airport as it gets, with a convenient shuttle bus -- but incredibly quiet. Walking distance to In-N-Out Burger and the Millbrae BART station, which was very nice. Parking is generally $20/day, which is a bummer, but I managed to get a 50% discount; the staffer liked my Giants hat. The hotel shows some age, particularly with the room door handles. Standard, exceedingly comfortable Westin bed. Nice desk, comfortable sitting-area chair and ottoman, HDTV. The hotel overall is very well maintained. But it's not new. I'd wholeheartedly recommend.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, bed, staff, hotel bar, cleanliness
review.negativeRemarks: No free parking
review.locationRemarks: Couldn't be much closer to the airport. And a huge bonus that it's walking distance from the Millbrae BART station.

review.title: Pretty Darn Good
review.reviewText: The hotel was amazing really, only bad thing is you have to pay for parking even as a guest of the hotel. The lounge was ok, the bartender had a preference of some people it seemed. The room was amazing, beds were fantastic. I felt well rested when I left. I would recommend to anyone who has to spend the night at SFO or even just wants to escape the city, you are close to everything.
review.negativeRemarks: Preferential treatment
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location off the 101 and near SFO.

review.title: Convenient Proximity to SFO
review.reviewText: Closest hotel to airport. Very convenient shuttle service to airport. Very nicely kept hotel. Nice pool. Good place to relax before travelling.
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: Closest Hotel to SFO

review.title: Small, dingy and overpriced
review.reviewText: The hotel rooms were very small and disappointing in terms of decor. The furniture was scratched and chairs dirty. Bathroom was likewise very small. I think this hotel is way overpriced for what you get in a room.

review.title: disappointed
review.reviewText: disappointed from previous stay: phone not working; no directory of available services; pillows not comfortable; had to plead with maids for replacement coffee, cream and sugar daily.
review.negativeRemarks: service or lack thereof
review.locationRemarks: great!

review.title: Wonderful hotel
review.reviewText: I recommand this hotel to everyone. It is clean and comfortable.

review.title: Just OK
review.reviewText: Noisy - not from the airport location but the hotel itself.

review.title: Hot
review.reviewText: Could notn adjust temp in room...too hot all night.
review.negativeRemarks: Temp control
review.locationRemarks: Convenient t airport

review.title: Some staff members are not friendly
review.reviewText: Very good. Just one thing, the water bottles were open in my room(there are one complimentary bottled water and two chargable ones) so I called and let the people know. What they said is they would check on them, did not confirm I wouldn't be charged. That conversation was not pleasant at all obviously, and the staff's attitude was like 'ok, we will see, just wait.'
review.negativeRemarks: Staff attitude
review.locationRemarks: SFO

review.title: Nickel and dime the customer
review.reviewText:
Great location if you need to be close to SFO airport.
Room was reasonably comfortable.

Given the base cost of my room, I was not impressed with having to pay:
$20/night for parking
$9 for WiFi access
$2.50 for plain bottled water in the room

I'd look for a place with better value next time.

review.title: Does its job, Bathrooms needs updating
review.reviewText: We needed a room for an evening. This hotel is perfectly situated and provides easy access to the airport. The staff is polite and is quick to respond to any needs. My only complaint is the bathroom. I found a woman's used pair of fake lashes by the sink which made me feel like the cleaning staff may not be very attentive. Makes you wonder what other things they may overlook. The bathroom also had several holes in the walls from plumbing corrections that had not been properly refinished and rust was everywhere. If your exhausted and need a room I can't imagine you would complain about these things (like I was).

review.title: it is fine to me.
review.reviewText: near by airport, very easier go around.

review.title: Westin SFO Airport
review.reviewText: Service personal were courteous, helpful and good but the overall cleanness of the room and lobby were not upto Westin standards. The food in the restaurant needs a revamp.

review.title: Tired hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is undergoing renovations - and it needs them. This is a tired hotel and whilst it wasn't bad - it did not meet my expectations and past experience of the Crowne Plaza brand. The service was friendly and no complaints there.

review.title: Beautiful rooms, would go back
review.reviewText: The roomwas beautiful. Carpet in the lobby looked rough. That was minor. The service was wonderful. The room was fantastic.

review.title: Don't stay here
review.reviewText: This is the ugliest, smelliest Westin I have ever visited. Horrible experience.

review.title: Best Hotel
review.reviewText: Love this place! the pool is not so big but its good for a toddler because its an indoor pool and its open all year round. The service is awesome. I would say we come here 4-5 times a year. They are very lenient and pets are allowed. The atmosphere is nice. I love this place and the people that works there.

review.title: Wanting to go back
review.reviewText: I loved the feel of the hotel everyone was courteous and kind. The bed was amazing! I don't know if I would have gotten up if I did not have a plane to catch. My only concern is I would have liked to have seen the shower head cleaned better.

review.title: Westin SFO
review.reviewText: Very pleased with the hotel, except that the parking is expensive.

review.title: Nice Hotel Close to Airport
review.reviewText: Very comfortable, modern Hotel close to the AirPort SFO; New furnished rooms! Shuttle service to Aipt SFO!

review.title: pero
review.reviewText: pero

review.title: I'd go back.
review.reviewText: Good shuttle system, friendly staff, we had a good night sleep. Wish we would have had timeto use the pool and spa - maybe next time.

review.title: Good Airport Hotel
review.reviewText: Convenient to the airport and a quick drive into the city. Clean rooms, nice pool and hottub area, and friendly staff. Overall a good value.

review.title: Convenient SFO Hotel
review.reviewText: The SFO Westin offers comfortable rooms, upgraded amenities and a nice commons area. Front desk staff was very nice at check-in and transferred the parking fee to my bill. Some minor criticisms include the airport noise in your room (ask for a room not facing the runway) and the cost of overnight parking ($20 for parking lot). I loved the double-head shower and nice toiletries provided. The price was also competitive with other hotels in the area. I would stay again.

review.title: Awesome hotel!
review.reviewText:
The bed was excellent! Their hotel lobby was nicely decorated and had a very comfortable feeling. One morning we were up around 5am and there was Starbucks coffee in the lobby but there is also Starbucks coffee available in your room as well to brew.

I did not like the fact that even in public areas like the lobby, you still had to pay for internet access. I brought my laptop down and wanted to do some work but tip: pay for the 4 or 5 hours through the internet and do not go in their business center to use their computers! The rate of using the internet in there is much more expensive than buying it through your own laptop.

review.title: sfo
review.reviewText: great hotel, very comfy bed! Right near airport, overlooking water and planes. Food is pricey but worth it. Nice atmosphere. Good with kids.

review.title: Good hotel if you're in transit
review.reviewText: Handy location, decent room size and well appointed room. It was just what we needed in between flights at SFO.

review.title: Great airport hotel
review.reviewText:
This hotel was exactly what I had hoped for. It was extremely convenient to SFO airport. In fact, you could watch the planes take off and land from the room (or the park across the street if you don't get a room with a view of the bay). And, the hotel is sound-proofed so you can't hear the planes.

The rooms were very nice - what you would expect of an upscale chain hotel. The rooms were clean, the shower was great, the beds were comfortable. There are several nearby restaurants.

Cons: It cost extra for parking and for internet access.

review.title: No maid service
review.reviewText: Was looking forward to the Westin service and Heavenly bed but all we got was a not so heavenly experience. We stayed for two nights. We left the hotel early on the second day and we returned later that evening to find that our beds were never made. We did not get any replacement towels. When we called to complain, they didn't come fix the beds they only brought up towels. It took about 20 minutes for them to arrive. The room smelled musty and the bathroom tile had some dark mold in the corners. This hotel did not feel like a Westin. I shouldve stayed at th Hilton or hyatt.

review.title: Comfort and quality
review.reviewText: This hotel was professionally managed. My wife and I were impressed with the quality of the restaurant and the courteous staff.

review.title: The Westin San Francisco Airport
review.reviewText:
The room was very comfortable and clean, and it was surprisingly quiet, given that it is very close to the San Francisco Airport. I also appreciated that it was possible to make the room very dark, as I am a light sleeper.
The only complaint I had is that the restaurant was VERY overpriced! The location is somewhat isolated, and, unless you have a car, take the hotel shuttle, take a taxi, or walk a fair distance, you're pretty much forced to eat in the restaurant. We were stunned at how much breakfast cost: forty-four dollars (including tip). For breakfast? Come on - ridiculous!

review.title: top of my list
review.reviewText: As expected of any Westin property, this is how it should be - clean, no musty smell,uncluttered and convenoent room service. Westin still holds top of my hotel list as they deliver and maintain overall good quality.

review.title: Expensive, and no free continental breakfast.
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice. The hotel restaurant was pretty expensive, with no free continental breakfast, unless you belonged to the Westin Travel club or something like that.

review.title: Good value near SFO (for the time being)
review.reviewText: This hotel was OK, and not too noisy, considering the proximity to the airport. That proximity, along with its convenience w/r/t Burlingame, Hillsborough, San Mateo, and the South San Francisco biotech super-cluster are its greatest strengths. One downside was that the the lobby gift shop was closed from late morning to late afternoon during my weekend stay, so if you wanted a newspaper or Starbucks around midday without having to leave the hotel, you were out of luck. But the price was right on the weekend; it was good value (at least temporarily). [Note: I generally avoid hotels in the Starwood chain when traveling on business because I have been burned in the past by their 3 day advance notice cancellation policy at some of their hotels. This is outrageous, in my opinion, since most other hotels have a 24 hr notice policy. So I would advise staying here only if you are fairly certain that your travel plans will not be changing.]

review.title: Great Start To Wine Country Trip
review.reviewText: Enjoyed our stay. Easy to get to from the airport, nice entry, very good service, room very pleasant.

review.title: Conference May 2010
review.reviewText: The hotel restaurant was very expensive and in order to find other places to eat you had to walk a long way. I would not want to walk the area alone at night. I found it ridiculous to have to pay $4.50 for a cup of coffee.

review.title: Excelent airport hotel
review.reviewText: I arrived at 2 o'clock in the morning and I found a quick transport from the airport to the hotel and there a very warm staff welcome. My room was excelent and all the services and facilities too.

review.title: Extremely Satisfied!
review.reviewText: The hotel is traditional Westin. Very classy and exquisite. The room decor is wonderful and made us feel comfortable immediately. Considering the close proximity to the international airport, we were not disturbed by the air traffic at all. Everything was perfect; just needed an extra night!

review.title: Great hotel with ultimate convenience
review.reviewText: The SFO Westin lives up to the Westin standard and very conveniently located near the San Francisco airport. Perfect for those quick trips for meetings, company visits, etc. Smells great!!

review.title: Westin quality, very close to SFO airport
review.reviewText: Generally within expected Westin quality (ie: nice beds!). Hotel overall in good condition. Best feature is proximity to SFO airport. Restaurant on ground floor was OK for dinner and breakfast. Convenient for a short overnight stay linked to flying in or out of SFO, but would not recommend for longer stays as really nothing around there to do and hotel felt a bit impersonal, like most airport hotels have a tendency to do.

review.title: A little pricey for its location.
review.reviewText: The hotel is a 10 minute walk away from the nearest BART station. There are a few restaurants to eat within the 10 minute walking radius. Overall, I liked Westin Milbrae, except that they charge a fee for wireless internet as well as an expensive $20 per night guest parking. Also, since the hotel is situated near SFO airport, you constantly hear airplanes taking off and landing; it's inevitable.

review.title: convenient
review.reviewText: only issue with the stay is the parking and having to pay for a space in a lot that is, ,on appearance, not located in a high demand area. really seems out of line.

review.title: Needs attention to cleaning service
review.reviewText:
Hotel was very conveniently located. Parking is $20/night for self-park.
When we checked in we found a soiled wash cloth draped over our shower curtain. Not what we expect at a Westin Hotel.

review.title: Great hotel for a quick stopover.
review.reviewText: My husband and I had a 24 hour stop over in San Francisco on route from Bangkok to Toronto. We landed December 31st and decided to stay close to the airport as we were flying out at noon the following day. The Westin was very convenient. We checked into the hotel and took the train that runs directly from the airport into downtown San Francisco. The hotel is comfortable and used by airline personnel for their stopovers. As we had just come from Thailand where the hotels and service are wonderful, it was difficult to be overly impressed however the hotel suited our need on the day.

review.title: Very Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Great location, easy to get around city, staff very helpful and nice.

review.title: 'Okay' hotel with outstanding pool
review.reviewText:
Nice looking hotel and lobby, however the rooms are small and the cleaning leaves a little to be desired. Additionally we had two problems with room service. We asked for fries to be substituted for bread on one order and they refused even though they had prepared fries for a hamburger we also ordered. Then they brought the wrong dish - twice. In each instance they were rather unpleasant on the phone. We complained on checkout but although they apologized and said the room service staff should have performed better, they didn't offer to take the mistake off the bill.

On the other hand... just spend all your time in the absolutely glorious indoor pool area. If you are a lap swimmer you will love it here, and the L shape allows families to be on the side of the pool near the hot tub without disturbing the lap lanes. It has an atrium ceiling and lovely plantings with chairs all round the pool.Unlike th room, it was spotless.

review.title: Nice hotel at walking distance from BART
review.reviewText: Hotel was pretty good; clean room, nice & comfy bed, friendly staff. Some details of the room are a bit dated but that's not too bad. There is a Starbucks in the hotel and opens early in the morning. Hotel is convenient located about 10-15 min walking distance from Bart station and that brings you in about 20 mins in San Francisco downtown.

review.title: convenient, but
review.reviewText: this hotel is convenient as it is near to SFO, and despite this, is very quiet and kept to high standards of maintenance, cleanliness and service you would expect in a Westin. one major downside is, however, the additional charge for parking, which seems somewhat contrite to me give the location.

review.title: Adequate for a layover
review.reviewText: Acceptable hotel for a layover. The hotel shuttle from the airport can be found on the DEPARTURE level of the airport!?

review.title: Convenient and comfortable
review.reviewText: The hotel is very convenient to the airport which is the reason I chose it. I was returning from a trip overseas and needed to rest. I chose price over view so I looked out over the air conditioning equipment! The bath was small and had not been remodeled as much as I would have liked but it was O.K. I had Room Service for dinner. It was served promptly and was excellent. Limousine service to the airport the next morning was very good .

review.title: Over priced and under sized
review.reviewText:
The Westin is supposed to be a higher end hotel. The Marriot down the street is much nicer, more spacious and more ammenities.
The rooms are very tight and the bathroom is even tighter. Every day we had to ask for towels, because they only left 2 small ones each day. The bedspread had stains on it and I don't even want to know what from. Yikes!
The food was ok, yet completely outrageously over priced and there is no place right next to the hotel to go to. Everything was a 15 minute walk. There is nothing Vegetarian or vegan friendly on the menu.
The seminar room was good though and most of the staff were friendly and helpful. The best thing about the hotel was that they do have a tiny Starbucks coffee. That saved every morning.

review.title: Would Stay There Again
review.reviewText: Great hotel and wonderful location for overnighting near SFO. We were leaving for Hawaii the next day, and had the entire afternoon free. After we checked in, we took the shuttle back to SFO and hopped on the BART to go into San Franciso and visit the Wharf. BART is comfortable and fast.

review.title: Convenient to SFO
review.reviewText: Comfy bed and linens. Nice sundries and relaxing Westin exclusive TV Channel.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: This was a great place to stay for not a huge chunk of change. Within walking distance to the BART system and several eating places. Shuttle available to and from airport so never needed a car!

review.title: nice but could use some improvement
review.reviewText: Liked the location a lot. Close to the bay... If you like to run or walk there is a path along the water. The bar is nice. The rooms & bed are comfy. I had a clean room. A few things I felt could be improved upon: customer service (the lady that checked me in seemed a bit rude). Also, the toilet in the room wasnt working properly upon check in as well as the phone by the bed but both were resolved in a timely manner. Overall I had a nice overnight stay & would probably return.

review.title: No Water
review.reviewText: We choose to stay at the Westin to make it easier to get to the airport in the morning with two kids. Big Mistake. There was no valet to help with the bags, a long line at both check in and check out, it took forever to get food, and in the morning there was no hot water! The front desk said that all the hotels in the area were affected, but on the shuttle ride to the airport we found out (the shuttle is shared with other hotels) that we were the only hotel with no hot water... they had lied to us! We will select a different hotel in the future.

review.title: Good stay but the hotel is showing its age
review.reviewText: We got a great rate at this Westin and enjoyed our stay. The overall experience was OK. However, I have high expectations for Westin which left me a little disappointed as this hotel is definitely showing its age. (It really needs an update.) I was also surprised that they charge $18 a day for parking. Its probably on their web site somewhere but I missed it. And they charge for internet access ---- seems so 20th century.

review.title: Wonderful
review.reviewText: The Westin that we stayed at was very well maintained and the room was beautiful. Everything was top notch from the bed sheets to the soap that looked like a leaf. I would recommend this to anyone who would like to stay in San Francisco without the high price that other hotels have within downtown. It's very nicely upgraded for the price that you pay to stay.

review.title: Awesome experience
review.reviewText: My husband and I spent our wedding night there before flying out the next morning. The bed was comfortable. The room and bathroom were spotless. The staff was very friendly.

review.title: Great customer service
review.reviewText: Restaurant staff was very accommodating and they were quick to bring up room service and help us out with our bags. I'd be happy to stay there again.

review.title: Not the best westin in the world
review.reviewText: At a discounted rate it's a you get what you pay for. Don't think i would book it at the normal rate. The room and bath are clean and roomy but looked dated and needed to be renovated now. It has the whole westin package (Heavenly shower / bed / etc). I stayed in Westin Pittsburgh, for Westin SFO i guess it's at barely above the minimum westin standard.

review.title: Great for the price!
review.reviewText: Hotel was decent, clean quiet. We stayed here for a wedding and were satisfied with the room. Service was a bit slow at the front desk and they allow pets which was a turn off for me.

review.title: great place for runners
review.reviewText: Hotel was comfortable, conveniently located to aurport and accommodating for runners.

review.title: Will stay again
review.reviewText: Good location, close to airport, shuttle service to airport, comfortable beds. Resturant not an outstanding experience for a name brand hotel.

review.title: Pretty good
review.reviewText: The only thing I didn't like about this hotel was the restaurant: it wasn't vegetarian friendly. One dish is pretty much it. Other than that, the room was nice and the front desk staff were very helpful.

review.title: Would stay there again.
review.reviewText: Convenient location to airport and downtown.

review.title: Good Choice
review.reviewText: We were visiting family in the northern counties of Napa, Marin for a few days but had an early morning flight out of SFO. So, we wanted to stay near the airport for convenience. We enjoyed a pleasant stay, check in was quick and friendly and the room was comfortable. We also enjoyed a light supper and drinks in the bar. We hopped a shuttle service to the airport. The price of our stay was very reasonable. Have not been disappointed by Westin yet.

review.title: Good Hotel
review.reviewText: The rooms were large and comfortable. Bed was great. Very convenient to the airport with a routine shuttle. Nothing else really in the area - you have to walk a bit to find a restaurant.

review.title: Terrible, I was shocked!
review.reviewText: The Westin has always been a favorite of mine, but this trip was the exception. I was put in a dirty room! The bed was unmade, the glasses were used and worse off, the trash had not been emptied. The staff quickly had me change rooms without so much as a discount or room upgrade and bairly an appology. I will NEVER stay at this hotel again!

review.title: Less than expected
review.reviewText: I expected a plush experience at a Westin-branded property, but it turned out that the hotel was operating on a decades-old model: $12-15 for in-room internet access; $5 for bottled water on the desk; silly minibar prices. I don't know why they choose this model for dealing with guests, but I won't recommend it to others for this reason.

review.title: Nice Hotel Close to Airport
review.reviewText: If you do not need to go into the city and either connecting flights or have to meet for a meeting the Westin is a nice spot to stay.

review.title: Convenient for South San Fran business visits
review.reviewText: The hotel was close to the airport without the usual airplane noise. The town of Millbrae was close by with grocery shopping and restaurant choices nearby. The hotel staff was nice and the walking path along the bay was very enjoyable. The price was competitive and I would gladly return. The Bart train was also very close to the hotel.

review.title: Westin is excellent
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel with clean spacious room with the most luxurious, comfortable bed of any hotel. Room had flat screen TV and nice view. Even without the view it was clean and top of the line. Restaurant food was good, not great, and service was slow, but it was early morning. Overall I would return without hesitation.

review.title: Great Airport Hotel
review.reviewText: More expensive than other available hotels but was worth it to have somewhere quiet, clean & comfortable.

review.title: Nice hotel, not a centralized location
review.reviewText: I stayed in this hotel for a business trip and while it was close to the airport and very comfortable it's not near anything that you can get to by foot. Everything is a taxi ride.

review.title: Great restaurant service
review.reviewText: Not bad for a hotel located in a business district and very close to the airport takeoff runway.

review.title: Taking the Whole Family next year
review.reviewText: It was a nice place to stay.. We went to celebrate our anniversary! The only problem we experienced was there wasn't many places at all to eat around the hotel...

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Only spent one night there after a late flight. My wife and inlaws stayed there before heading to Napa Valley for vacation. Great hotel. The lobby bartender was very friendly. Location is across from a park and only a few blocks away from the best bagels outside of New York city I have ever had. Valet and Self park options is great.

review.title: Sweet Dreams
review.reviewText: Sweet dreams are almost guaranteed at Westin Hotels due to the extreme comfort of their beds. It is the foremost reason I will continue to book with Westin besides the service, amenities and Wifi. In particular, the Milbrae Westin is very easy to access by car if traveling along the San Francisco Peninsula. Parking is at the hotel and this makes a stop over on the way to San Francisco a breeze!

review.title: Not perfect
review.reviewText: We stayed here to avoid the "red eye" experience. A big flaw was horrible service at the lobby bar where we waited over an hour for a snack. The hotel doesn't let much noise in from the airport, but has very little interior noiseproofing. This was made worse by the large number of flight crews coming and going at all hours. The room was very nice, the staff friendly and helpful. It was fairly easy to take BART into the city (we had to shuttle to the airport first). The shuttle is very good, and we should have dropped off the rental car the day before to save some hassle. All in all, not bad, but not a bargain.

review.title: decent hotel
review.reviewText: overall OK

review.title: impressed
review.reviewText: I spent a long time trying to decide where to stay in San Fransico for last night of holiday. This hotel is a 10 minute walk from the Bart train service into san fransico (the free shuttle bus to the airport will also drop you off every 20 minutes. Compared to San Fransico priced hotels this was great value for money, especially as near to the airport and you don't have to check out till 1pm, ideal for me prior to a long haul flight home. Room was great, clean and very comfortable, i also got a view of the bay. Nicely maintained bay walk way across the road from the hotel.

review.title: Excellent hotel close to airport
review.reviewText: Close to airport, but no noise disturbance. Didn't even realize how close to airport we were until we walked outside of Hotel. Fast & easy shuttle service to airport.

review.title: Good place to stay
review.reviewText: This hotel is a great place to stay if you are flying in or out of SFO. My husband and I had an early flight to catch. We actually came in on Bart the night before and the hotel shuttle picked us up. Very comfortable rooms and very quiet. It took 40 minutes for us to get a cork screw delivered to our room and my pre ordered breakfast never came. Overall the hotel was nice and the restraunt there was very good and the service was excellant! That was the best part of our stay. The shuttle the next morning was on time and the rooms have starbucks coffee and traveling cups which was very nice. It was a great start to our long day of traveling.

review.title: Very dissatisfied
review.reviewText: I was surprised - there was a steep added parking charge. The TV clicker didn't work. The TV programs very limited. Sink stopper didn't work. No complimentary breakfast.

review.title: weekend get away
review.reviewText: great place to stay and relax.

review.title: beautiful hotel
review.reviewText: This is a nice hotel, as all Westin's are. The check-in was quick and easy, the parking was great and the room service arrived hot and faster than they predicted. That said, we thought perhaps the walls between the rooms are a little thin, we heard the people right next to us all night, though they did not seem to be raising their voices, we could also hear their TV as if we were the ones watching it.

review.title: would recommend
review.reviewText: The complimentary airport shuttle runs with a frequency to suit anyone's need and the drivers are knowledgable about the terminals and very pleasant. Not having a rental car made it hard to go to eat off the hotel property. The room was very quiet especially for as close to the airport it is.

review.title: great shower and bed!
review.reviewText: After a long and hectic day a great hot shower was fabulous.....and 2 shower heads....the bed was comfortable and the Tv was great!!!!!Ill stay there again on purpose!!

review.title: Disappointing Property
review.reviewText: Advertised as a "bay view" room, it actually overlooks either the airport runways or a commercial district with a sliver of water showing. Particularly for this chain, the room was rundown and the decor shabby, and the air conditioning was noisy. The bed, though, was very comfortable. The food in the restaurant was fair but definitely nothing memorable. One bright spot--the service was very good; the staff was helpful and cheerful.

review.title: Close to airport
review.reviewText: Comfortable bed. Good quality for the price.

review.title: Convenient for SFO
review.reviewText: Extremely convenient for San Francisco International airport.

review.title: Great place near SFO
review.reviewText: Beautiful, comfortable place to stay near SFO. My wife and I needed to catch an early flight, and arrived late at the hotel the evening prior. Staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was roomy, clean, quiet, and beautiful. Shuttles to/from SFO run every 20 minutes--very convenient.

review.title: Westin SF Airport
review.reviewText: Hotel was within a 10 minute shuttle ride to the airport. Staff was professional and facility was in good shape. Bar could use improvement, its not up to the Westin standard but otherwise a nice place to stay.

review.title: 20 minutes just to check in!
review.reviewText: Our stay started with a wait of 20 mins just to check in because they only had one person at the check in counter. The rooms were ok but I would not call this a 4 star experience. The pool was nice, except for the 35+ kids doing cannon balls around my 6yo daughter. I suppose that is not the hotel's fault but the 20 minute wait pretty much set the tone for the entire stay. Oh and when I checked out the girl asked me if I bought anything from the Mini bar...of course upon check in I was never offered a key to the fridge to begin with!

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: The room was clean and comfortable

review.title: Without hesitation would recommend a friend
review.reviewText: The cleaniness and fitting in the room was superb. Service was fantastic and the view from the room is very good. At the price I got from Expedia, it was "insanely" crazy. Take my word for it, you would not regret.

review.title: Very cozy stay!
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel!

review.title: Would definitely return on our next trip through San Francisco
review.reviewText: We were impressed with the incredible shuttle service, both timing & courtesy of the drivers. We liked the fast check in & check out. The room was clean & comfy. Loved the Westin dressing gown! We were quite stressed from a long day of travel. We appreciated how the conciere & desk people handled everything for us with courtesy & speed. We used room service which was timely. Thanks for the great stay! Cliff & Beth Larson

review.title: Very Enjoyable Stay
review.reviewText: Customer Service was exceptional

review.title: It is a wreck
review.reviewText: The hotel is in very bad shape. The heating system was defective and toliet ran constantly. I paid $30 for a cold pizza from room service because they sent it to the wrong room.

review.title: Reasonable airport hotel, quick links to city
review.reviewText: Hotel has good courtesy bus service running every 15-20 minutes to/from SFO terminals with 5-10 minute trip time out of peak. Hotel is modern with pleasant helpful staff. Hotel was quiet, little aircraft noise, which is good for airport location. Room was OK. Broadband had some issues with sign-up (watch for multiple charges on bill if problems occur) but worked well once connected. Restaurant was uninspiring but good portions and reasonable service. Has lobby terminals with free access to airline web sites to allow online check-in and print boarding pass - nice idea but I had issue with a BA check in, did not recognise all of site as free so asked for $5! I would certainly use this hotel again, a work collegue recommended it.

review.title: Great Room
review.reviewText: Staff was great. Loved the down comforter.

review.title: Well located for SFO
review.reviewText: We had to catch an early onward flight from San Francisco airport, so this hotel was usefully located - but we weren't really aware of any plane noise. There's a (free) shuttle bus to and from the airport every 15 mins and you can connect there with the BART train directly into the city. Room was a decent size and nicely done out - but in a style more suited for a business traveller. Would stay here again, no question.

review.title: Airports Best
review.reviewText: Our visit was very nice, you could not tell that you were that close to the airport. Our meeting was in San Francisco it was very easy to get to. I can't wait to go back.

review.title: IT'S THE BEST HOTEL
review.reviewText: I RECOMMENDED THIS HOTEL. IT'S A NICE HOTEL AND THE SERVICE IS GOOD.

review.title: Extremely dissatisfied
review.reviewText: The hotel staff were rude and were not helpful. They advise that they are a children friendly hotel. My experience shows that they are not. Will never stay there with my family again.

review.title: Great airport location
review.reviewText: Great location to SFO with airport shuttle service. Punctual, courteous and walking to near-by restaurants. Will stay again on next trip.

review.title: Good value for money
review.reviewText: Fair location, near the airport. OK for a layover, not recommended for sightseeing or shopping.

review.title: would definitely go back
review.reviewText: We were extrememly satisfied with this Westin. The rooms were a good size. Although they had double beds not queen, they were a good size and very comfortable. Nice restaurants, fitness and pool, and only 5 minutes with an on time shuttle to the airport.

review.title: clean and elegant
review.reviewText: The hotel was very clean and all ran smoothly

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: close to the airport, yet never heard a airplane.

review.title: Convenient to Airport
review.reviewText: Decent pricing and attentive service.

review.title: Nice!
review.reviewText: Was very happy with my stay here. Professional staff, comfortable rooms, surprisingly quiet! Convenient location to highway 101, the airport, and BART. Free shuttle to/from airport was comfortable and ran often. My room had a pretty good view of the bay. There's a nice walking/running path that starts across the street from the hotel and runs along the bay, and the hotel also has a small gym with a good variety of equipment. The restaurant and room service prices seemed a bit expensive, but there were a couple of restaurants within walking distance, and the staff had good recommendations for offsite eateries. I agree with other reviewers that charging for internet access in the lobby seemed excessive---I'm guessing that most people who stay here are on business, and probably travel with their laptop (and the hotel had internet access available in the rooms), but I've stayed in much less expensive hotels that offered internet access to their guests in the lobby or business center at no charge.

review.title: Can't wait to go back!
review.reviewText: We found the hotel to be perfect for us. We rented a car & drove to Fisherman's Wharf, (about 15 miles). The staff was very friendly & accomodated my early arrival. We would stay here again!

review.title: Nice & conveniet
review.reviewText: Ours was a short stay - in late and out early - but the check in process was efficient and the front desk staff very courteous. Because it was so close to the airport, it was a bit loud. A little soundproofing of the rooms would be good but it wasn't overly bad. I also don't feel that paying guests should have to pay to park in the hotel lot. We'd stay again.

review.title: real nice place for an airport hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel, good price, convenient shuttle from airport, nice view of San Fransisco bay too! Really nice beds with the new pillow top and flat screen TV.

review.title: Beautiful linens and quiet
review.reviewText: I was pleasantly surprised. Very quiet for being next to both the airport and freeway. The room was clean with wonderful linens. The airport shuttle was prompt. I will stay anytime I have travel out of SFO

review.title: Charge For Everything
review.reviewText: At the prices they charge for a room, they might give a little as part of it. Parking, Internet, all extra charge. Price for all items in store, a little steep. Not a soda machine to be found.

review.title: Modern surprise
review.reviewText: Well above the usual "airport" hotel with clean elegant modern decor. I arrived after an extended flight delay and they sent the free shuttle within 5 minutes even though it was nearly 2 am. I was greeted warmly and professionally. The 24 hour room service came in handy. Beautiful room, heavenly bed. They are renovating the whole place so ask for a renovated room.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Hotel is at a good location and provided overall excellant quality.

review.title: Great value, convenient location
review.reviewText: Good value compared to other hotels in San Francisco. Westin Heavenly Beds are truly heavenly....stayed at both Westins in the Bay Area and both had trademark "heavenly beds" Great sleeping!

review.title: Great room, wonderful bed!
review.reviewText: A little out of the way, but a joy to come to at the end of a busy day! Would love to go there again!

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText: Seems like an older place. The bed's nice (signature bed), however the room was dated and dark. Parking's $14 / day which is pretty average for the SFO area. Overall, a bit disappointed...I was expecting more from a Westin.

review.title: Nice location
review.reviewText: Great location for running and walking along the Bay Trail. You are also a 5-minute walk from the Millbrae BART station, which means downtown San Francisco is a 30-minute ride.

review.title: Excellent airport hotel
review.reviewText: Very pleased with stay, great food available.

review.title: It's a winner !
review.reviewText: Extremely cordial staff...very comfortable room..easy shuttle to and from airport..concierge bends over backwards to help..beautiful walking path across street in front of Bay.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Nice

review.title: You call that a heavenly bed?
review.reviewText: I had heard the reputation of Westin's beds as being 'heavenly' to sleep on.  Ours was not the worst hotel bed we ever slept on but it certainly wasn't the best.  All the extra linens only serve to add weight to trap you against the not-so-heavenly mattress.  The double shower heads were a nice compensation though.

review.title: Westin is very comfortable
review.reviewText: The steps taken by Westin to improve their image has succeeded.  The rooms are very comfortable and we enjoyed every minute of our stay.  The front desk staff were helpful and the location was ideal for our departure out of San Fran airport the next day.  Quiet, comfortable and luxurious!  The airport shuttle was the clincher!
